translation.yo: Àbálọ àbábọ̀, ó kúrò ní ilé-ìwé, ó sì di ẹni-àpẹẹrẹ àwòrán láti so ẹ̀mí àti ara ró. Ẹni tí ó ṣiṣẹ́ fún tí ó san owó ọ̀yà HK$500 dollars (US$65) fún un ni ó pa a.
translation.en: She was murdered by a client who had paid her HK$500 dollars (US$65) to take pictures of her.

translation.yo: Òmíràn jẹ́ òkú ọmọ-ọwọ́ kan tí ìwọ́ọ rẹ̀ ṣì wà ní a ara rẹ̀, tí obìrin kan tí ó ń ṣe ìmọ́tótó ìbùdókọ̀ abẹ́-ilẹ̀ ní Yau Ma Tei bá nínú àpò kan.
translation.en: In another case, a dead baby with its umbilical cord intact was found in a bag in Yau Ma Tei subway station by a cleaning lady.

translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ìwádìí, àwọn ọlọ́pàá ṣe àrídájú wípé ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ kan láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè tí ó ń bẹ̀rù wípé ọ̀gá òun yóò lé òun ni ẹnu iṣẹ́ bí ó bá mọ̀ wípé òun ní oyún ni ìyáa rẹ̀. Obìrin náà jẹ èrè iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ọ rẹ̀ ní ẹ̀wọ̀n.
translation.en: Upon investigation, the police found out that the mother was a foreign domestic helper who became pregnant and was afraid that her employers would dismiss her. The woman was arrested and jailed.

translation.yo: Ní abala ìrìnàjò afẹ́ yìí, amọ̀nà ṣe ìbéèrè: ṣé àwọn ọ̀gá obìnrin náà kò jẹ̀bi bí?
translation.en: During this segment of the tour, the guide raises the question: aren't the woman's employers also guilty?

translation.yo: Kò sí bí ó ṣe lè ṣẹlẹ̀ kí wọn ó máà mọ̀ wípé ẹni tí ó ń ṣiṣẹ́ fún wọn ní ojúmọ́ ní oyún ní inú.
translation.en: It is difficult to imagine not noticing that the person who served you daily is pregnant.

translation.yo: Ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ tí ó wà ní Hong Kong ju 370,000 lọ, òfin ṣì fi àyè gbà wọ́n kí ó máa gbé nínú ilé ọ̀gáa wọn.
translation.en: There are more than 370,000 helpers in Hong Kong and the law requires them to live in their employers’ homes.

translation.yo: Èyí ni àyè fi sílẹ̀ láti lè rí wọn bá sùn bí wọn bá ń ṣiṣẹ́ fún wákàtí púpọ̀, láì jẹun tí ó ṣe ara ní oore, àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
translation.en: This arrangement makes them vulnerable to abuse in the form of long working hours, poor diet, etc.

translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ọdún kan tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yẹn wáyé, ọmọ-ọ̀dọ̀ ilẹ̀-òkèèrè mìíràn gba ìdádúró ní ẹnu iṣẹ́ fún oyún tí ó ní.
translation.en: About a year after that case, another foreign domestic helper was fired for getting pregnant.

translation.yo: Ó gba obìnrin náà ní ọdún méjì gbáko nílé ẹjọ́ láti jà fún ìdádúró láì bá òfin mu ní ẹnu iṣẹ́.
translation.en: It took two years for the woman to successfully appeal the illegal termination of the contract in court.

translation.yo: Ìpànìyàn ní àárín àwọn ènìyàn
translation.en: Grassroots murderers

translation.yo: Ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ ìpànìyàn ní Yau Ma Tei jẹ́ ẹsẹ̀ tí ó ti ọwọ́ àwọn ènìyàn fún ra wọn wá, tí ó jẹ́ ẹsẹ̀ tí wọn kò gbèrò tàbí pa ète rẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀, tí àwọn tí ó dá ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ sì ṣe àṣìṣe.
translation.en: Many of the murders in Yau Ma Tei are crimes of passion committed by ordinary people, and as is typical when the crime is not premeditated, the perpetrators make many mistakes.

translation.yo: Ó ní ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ọkùnrin kan pa ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọn rẹ̀ ọkùnrin ní ìta gbangba ní ojúu títì pẹ̀lú ọbẹ̀ ìwọ̀n ínṣì mẹ́sàn-án tí ó wọ inú ẹ̀dọ̀ fóró ẹ̀gbọ́n-ọn rẹ̀ lọ.
translation.en: There is the case in which a man killed his older brother in an open street with a nine-inch fish knife that penetrated the brother's lungs.

translation.yo: Ẹ̀bùn ni ó yẹ kí ọbẹ̀ náà jẹ́ fún ẹ̀gbọ́n náà.
translation.en: The knife was supposed to be a gift for the brother.

translation.yo: Apànìyàn kan takú sí ibi ìpànìyàn lẹ́yìn tí ó pa ènìyàn tán; òmíràn fi ìwé pẹlẹbẹ ìdánimọ̀ọ rẹ̀ gba iyàrá tí ó tọ́jú òkú ẹni tí ó pa sí.
translation.en: One killer stayed at the crime scene after the murder; another used his ID card to book a hotel room to hide the body.

translation.yo: Ìpànìyàn mìíràn wáyé ní ilé ìtaja-ohun-èlò-inú-ilé.
translation.en: Another murder took place in a convenience store.

translation.yo: Ẹ̀rọ-ayàwòrán amóhùnmáwòrán ká ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà sílẹ̀.
translation.en: The incident was recorded by closed-circuit TV.

translation.yo: Onírìn àjò ìgbafẹ́ tí ó ń lo ìwé-ìrìnnà Orílẹ̀-èdè Canada ni apànìyàn náà, ẹni tí ó gún òǹtajà ìsọ̀ náà nígbà tí òǹtajà bíi léèrè ìdí tí ó fi kó ọjà láì san owó.
translation.en: The murderer was a tourist holding a Canadian passport, who stabbed the storekeeper after the latter questioned him for taking items from the shop without paying.

translation.yo: Àlábàápàdé àwọn ẹ̀mí àti òjìjíi wọn
translation.en: An encounter with souls and their shadows

translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn arìnrìn-àjò afẹ́ jẹ́ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga.
translation.en: The majority of tour patrons are college students.

translation.yo: Àwọn kan kópa nítorí wọ́n fẹ́ rí àrídájú; àwọn mìíràn rí i bí ọ̀nà láti fi ìmọ̀ kún ìmọ̀.
translation.en: Some join out of curiosity; others consider it a way to educate themselves.

translation.yo: Oníṣègùn kan tí í ṣe ikọ̀ òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera tí ó ṣe ìrìnàjò náà sọ wípé:
translation.en: A doctor who was part of a team of medical workers who took the tour said this of one case:

translation.yo: Ẹni ọ̀ràn yìí dà bíi àwọn aláàárẹ̀ tí a máa ń bá pàdé nínú ìyára ìtọ́jú àwọn tí ó ní ìjàmbá àti ìtọ́júu pàjàwìrì – àwọn tí egbògi olóró tí sọ di ìdàkudà, àwọn tí ó ń sun títì, àwọn ogún-lé-mi-dé.
translation.en: The protagonist of the case is very similar to the patients we often encounter in the accident and emergency wards – drug addicts, street sleepers, refugees.

translation.yo: Iṣẹ́ẹ gbogbo wa ni láti dóòlà ẹ̀míi wọn ní yàráa pàjàwìrì.
translation.en: We all have to rescue them in the emergency room.

translation.yo: Àmọ́ wọ́n máa ń kanra nígbà mìíràn.
translation.en: But usually they are quite hostile in their attitudes.

translation.yo: Kì í rọrùn bí a bá ń ṣe ìtọ́júu wọn, nítorí náà a máa sọ sùúrù nù.
translation.en: It’s very difficult to deal with them and we tend to lose patience over time.

translation.yo: Ìrìnàjò afẹ́ yìí rán wa létí wípé a nílòo sùúrù bí a bá ń dá àwọn aláàárẹ̀ lóhùn.
translation.en: This guided tours remind us that we must be patient and should not become indifferent.

translation.yo: Àti pé ayé ìrora ni wọ́n ń gbé, wọ́n sì ń tiraka láti gbé.
translation.en: And their lives are very miserable and they struggle hard to survive.

translation.yo: Onírúurú ikú ni yóò pa gbogbo àwọn olùgbée 20,000 Yau Ma Tei.
translation.en: Yau Ma Tei's 20,000 residents will all eventually die in different ways.

translation.yo: Ìgbàgbọ́ọ wa ni wípé bí ikú bá kanlẹ̀kùn, ẹ̀míi wọn yóò máa ráre kiri ní àárín-in àdúgbò àti ní òpópónà, láti máa rán àwọn ènìyàn létí nípa ìtúmọ̀ ìwà láyé.
translation.en: We believe that upon their death, their souls will become part of the fabric of the city and continue to linger in the alleys and streets, reminding people of the meaning of existence.

translation.yo: Ìrìnàjò yìí ń lépa láti pèsè àyè fún àwọn òjìjí láti sọ ìtàn ara wọn.
translation.en: The tour aims to create a space for these shadows to reveal their stories.

translation.yo: Ohun tí ó ń fa ikú ni ìbàjẹ́ ọkàn tí a ò wò sàn.
translation.en: The number one cause of suicide is untreated depression.

translation.yo: Ìbàjẹ́ ọkàn ní ìwòsàn, a sì lè dènà ìpànìyàn.
translation.en: Depression is treatable and suicide is preventable.

translation.yo: Ó lè rí ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tí ó ń bá ìparaẹni fà á àti àwọn tí ó wà nínú ìbàjẹ́ ọkàn.
translation.en: You can get help from confidential support lines for the suicidal and those in emotional crisis.

translation.yo: Lọ sí Befrienders.org fún ojú òpó ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ìdènà ìparaẹni ní orílẹ̀-èdèe rẹ.
translation.en: Visit Befrienders.org to find a suicide prevention helpline in your country.

translation.yo: Olórí orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan tàkùrọ̀sọ àkọ́kọ́ ní orí amóhùnmáwòrán lẹ́yìn ọdún 15 ní orí àlééfà. Ó lè lo ọ̀nà mìíràn.
translation.en: Azerbaijan leader gives first TV interview after 15 years in office. He could use more practice.

translation.yo: Ìfọ̀rọ̀wọ́rọ̀ Ààrẹ Ilham Aliyev àti amóhùnmáwòran REAL TV ní Oṣù Èrèlé 12.
translation.en: President Ilham Aliyev's interview with REAL TV on February 12.

translation.yo: Àpá àwòrán wá láti REAL TV ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà YouTube channel.
translation.en: Screenshot from REAL TV's YouTube channel.

translation.yo: Ẹ̀rìn mélòó ló yẹ kí ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè ní ìtakùrọ̀sọ pẹ̀lú ilé ìgbéròyìn jáde tí ìlúu rẹ̀?
translation.en: How often should a country's leader give interviews to the local media of that country?

translation.yo: Ẹẹ̀kan l'ọ́sẹ̀?
translation.en: Once a week?

translation.yo: Ẹẹ̀kan l'óṣù?
translation.en: Once a month?

translation.yo: Àwọn olórí orílẹ̀ èdè afipá ṣe ìjọba máa ń ṣe ìtakùrọ̀sọ pẹ̀lú àwọn ilé ìgbéròyìn jáde ní èèkàn l'ọ́dún tàbí kí ó kéré jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
translation.en: Rulers of authoritarian countries might sometimes settle on a very controlled interview with state media once a year or less.

translation.yo: Ìdáhùn sí ìbéèrè yìí kọyọyọ ní Azerbaijan.
translation.en: The answer to this question in Azerbaijan is quite extraordinary.

translation.yo: Ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù yìí, Ààrẹ Ilham Aliyev, tí ó di olórí ilẹ̀ Azerbaijan ní Oṣù Ọ̀wàrà ọdún 2003, ṣe ìtakùrọ̀sọ alákọ̀ọ́kọ́ọ rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ilé ìṣẹ́ amóhùn-máwòrán ti ìlúu rẹ̀.
translation.en: Earlier this month, President Ilham Aliyev, who became Azerbaijan's leader in October 2003, gave his first-ever interview to local television.

translation.yo: Ìfọ̀rọ̀-wáni-lẹ́nuwò oníwákàtí kan ọ̀hún tí ó wáyé lọ́jọ́ 12 oṣù yìí, pẹ̀lú oníròyìn ìjọba Mirshahin Aghayev — tí a ti mọ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀ rí fún ìdúróṣinṣin aìfi òlò p'ohùn — di gbígbésáfẹ́fẹ́ ní ilé ìṣẹ́ amóhùn-máwòrán aládàáni agbè fún ìjọba REAL TV.
translation.en: The hour-long February 12 interview with pro-government journalist Mirshahin Aghayev — once known for having a more independent stance — was broadcast on the privately owned pro-government broadcaster REAL TV.

translation.yo: Ó gbọn òǹgbẹ ni Azerbaijan, ilẹ̀ tí àwọn ará ìlú ti máa ń gbọ́ kí Aliyev sọ̀rọ̀ lórí afẹ́fẹ́, àmọ́ tí wọn kò sì rí i rí kó tàkùrọ̀sọ pẹ̀lú oníbèèrè.
translation.en: It aroused significant interest in Azerbaijan, where citizens are used to listening to Aliyev make speeches but unaccustomed to seeing him discuss ideas with an interlocutor.

translation.yo: Kódà ìṣàmúlò Twitter Aliyev dà gẹ́gẹ́ bí wèrè aládàásọ̀rọ̀ ju ìgbìyànjú ìbá ará ìlú sọ̀rọ̀ lọ.
translation.en: Even Aliyev's Twitter account comes across as a bizarre monologue rather than an attempt at public outreach.

translation.yo: Ní ìgbẹ̀yìn-gbẹ́yín, ìfọ̀rọ̀-wáni-lẹ́nuwò ọ̀hún jẹ́ àkọ́ṣe tí ó kọyọyọ.
translation.en: In the end, however, the interview proved an underwhelming debut.

translation.yo: Púpọ̀ àwọn tí ó wà lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára gbogbo sọ̀rọ̀ lórí aìkọbì-ara sí bí ààrẹ ṣe gbé ara rẹ̀, bí ó ṣe múra àti àwọn kókó tí ilé ìṣe ìgbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ ìjọba sọ̀rọ̀ lé lórí.
translation.en: Many on social media commented on the president's understated body language, somewhat dazed appearance and a reliance on state media talking points.

translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ti mọ̀ pé kò pọn dandan kí Aliyev ṣàfihàn ara rẹ̀ bí ó ṣe tó — Azerbaijan kòì tí ì dìbò tí kò sí kọ́mí-n-kọ́họ lẹ́yìn ọdún 37 tí ó ti gba òmìnira — kíni ó mú u ṣe èyí?
translation.en: Given that Aliyev does not have to impress anyone — Azerbaijan has never had a free and fair election in its 27-year independence — why did he bother to do this?

translation.yo: Ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwo Ààrẹ Ilham Aliyev's pẹ̀lú REAL TV ní ọjọ́ 12, oṣù Èrèlé.
translation.en: President Ilham Aliyev's interview with REAL TV on February 12.

translation.yo: Àwòrán láti orí ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà YouTube ti REAL TV.
translation.en: Screenshot from REAL TV's YouTube channel.

translation.yo: Àwọn kókó ìtakùrọsọ ọ̀hún dá lórí — ìjàkú akátá pẹ̀lú Armenia lóríi Nargono- Karabakh, iṣẹ́ ìlú, àtúnṣe sí ètò ọrọ̀ Ajé, àti ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú Ẹgbẹ́ Aláṣẹpọ̀ Eurasian àti Ẹgbẹ́ Aláṣẹpọ̀ Europe.
translation.en: The topics of the interview broadly mirrored those highlighted in state media — the long-standing conflict with Armenia over Nagorno-Karabakh, public services, economic reforms and Azerbaijan's relations with the Eurasian Union and European Union trade blocs.

translation.yo: A kò rí ohun tuntun kan gbámu.
translation.en: No new insights were provided.

translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ìgbà tí fídíò ọ̀hún gba kòbákùngbé ìjábọ̀ bíi “Kọ̀wé fipò sílẹ̀” àti “A kò fẹ́ àlọ́ atanijẹ mọ́” pẹ̀lú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àìní ìfẹ́ràn ní ọjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ tí a gbé e sórí ayélujára, ìkànnì REAL TV ní oríi YouTube ti ìsọsí pa.
translation.en: After the video received a host of negative comments like "Resignation" and "No more tales are needed" in addition to dislikes during its first day online, REAL TV's YouTube channel closed comments.

translation.yo: Olóṣèlú alátakò Azer Gasimli sọ pé ìfọ̀rọ̀-wáni-lẹ́nuwò ọ̀hún fi hàn pé "ìfoyà ti dé bá" ìjọba láàárín bí àwọn ará ìlú ò ṣe gba ti wọn àti ọ̀rọ̀ ajé ìlú tí ó ń ṣ'òjòjò.
translation.en: Opposition politician Azer Gasimli said the interview showed the government was "very worried" amid stewing public dissatisfaction and a sluggish economy.

translation.yo: Mo wo ìtàkùrọsọ àkọ́kọ́ tí Ilham Aliyev ṣe pẹ̀lú oníròyìn ilẹ̀ yìí kan.
translation.en: I watched Ilham Aliyev's first interview with a local journalist.

translation.yo: Mo rò pé kò mọ́gbọ́n dání láti sọ tàbí kọ nǹkan kan l’ ésì si ohun tí Ààrẹ sọ.
translation.en: I think it is meaningless to say or write something in response to what the President said.

translation.yo: Nítorí pé a ti ń fún un l'ésì fún ọdún pípẹ́.
translation.en: Because we have responded to him for many years.

translation.yo: Kò sí hóró òótọ́ kán nínú ìtàkùrọsọ ọ̀hún.
translation.en: The interview was not sincere.

translation.yo: Ààrẹ àti oníròyìn ọ̀hún rán mi l'étí nípa “ọkọ̀ tó léfòó lórí irọ́ ”.
translation.en: Both the President and the journalist remind me of "ships floating on a lie".

translation.yo: Ní àkótán: ara ò rọ ìjọba!
translation.en: My conclusion: the government is very worried!

translation.yo: Habib Muntazir, aládàádúró oníròyìn kan fi ẹ̀dùn ọkàn-an rẹ̀ hàn pé ìtàkùrọsọ ọ̀hún kò gbóòkàn:
translation.en: Habib Muntazir, an independent journalist also complained the interview was short on substance:

translation.yo: Nǹkan kan ṣo tí mo gbọ́ ni "Ìyá àgbà Saray".
translation.en: The only thing I learned was "Grandma Saray".

translation.yo: Ó dá mi lójú pé "Ìyá àgbà" yìí yóò ṣòro tí ó wúni lórí ju Ilham Aliyev lọ.
translation.en: I'm sure that this "grandma" would say something more interesting than Ilham Aliyev.

translation.yo: Ìfakùn ọ̀rọ̀ “Ìyá àgbà Saray” tí Muntazir mẹ́nubà dá lórí àbẹ̀wò ìbánidárọ tí Aliyev bá lọ sí Agbègbè Shamakhi tí Azerbaijan, níbi tí ìporùrù ayé tí bá ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé ìgbé jẹ́ ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù yìí, tí ọ̀kan nínú rẹ̀ jẹ́ ti obìrin ọlọ́mọdún 92 tí orúkọ rẹ ń jẹ́ Saray.
translation.en: Muntazir's reference to “Grandma Saray” addresses Aliyev's visit to the Shamakhi region of Azerbaijan, where an earthquake destroyed several homes earlier this month, including one belonging to a 92-year-old woman called Saray.

translation.yo: Ajábọ̀ iṣẹ́ ìjọba ti fúnpá lórí ìpàdé tí Aliyev ní pẹ̀lú Saray, ẹni tí ó ti gba oríyìn gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwòkọ́ṣe rere fún ìfaradà àti ìgbàgbọ́ tí ó ní sí ọjọ́ iwájú orílẹ̀-èdè Azerbaijan lẹ́yìn-in ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ náà.
translation.en: State propaganda had seized on Aliyev's meeting with Saray, who has since been celebrated as a model citizen for her stoicism and faith in the future of the Azerbaijani state after the quake.

translation.yo: Ilham Aliyev pàdé Ìyá àgbà Saray. Àwòrán láti qafkaz.info.
translation.en: Ilham Aliyev meets with Grandma Saray. Photo from qafkaz.info.

translation.yo: Bí a ṣe lè ri lára ìtú ìmọ̀ ìfọ̀rọ̀wọ́rọ̀ agbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ REAL TV l'órèfé, Aliyev sọ àsọdùn ọ̀rọ̀ nínú ìgbóríyìn fún arúgbó ọ̀hún, bí ò tí ṣe perí rẹ ní sísẹ̀ntẹ̀lé:
translation.en: As can be seen from an abridged translation of the REAL TV interview, Aliyev went overboard in his praise for the elderly citizen, name-checking her seven times in quick succession:

translation.yo: Irú ìyá àgbà àti àwọn ìyá, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi Ìyá àgbà Saray ti ń ṣakitiyan ìpamọ́ àwọn ìṣe orílẹ̀ wa àti ẹ̀mí-àìrí fún àìní ye ọgọ́rùn-ún ọdún.
translation.en: Such grandmothers and mothers, like Grandma Saray, have been preserving our national and spiritual values ​​for centuries.

translation.yo: Gbogbo obìnrin Azerbaijan ni ó fẹ́ fi ìwà jọ ìyá àgbà Saray.
translation.en: Every Azerbaijani woman wants to be akin to grandmothers Saray.

translation.yo: Wò ó, obìrin ọmọ ọdún 92 èyí tí ilé rẹ̀ ti di ìlẹ̀ẹ́lẹ̀, ìrètí gidi wo ló tún wà fún un mọ́!
translation.en: Look, a 92-year-old woman whose house is destroyed, how much optimism in this woman!

translation.yo: Ìyá àgbà Saray ní ìfọkàntẹ̀ pé ìjọba yóò dúró tì òun.
translation.en: Grandma Saray is confident that the state will be with her.

translation.yo: Kámáparọ́, nínú ìrìnàjò kékeré lọ sí Shamakhi, n kò rò ó tì tẹ́lẹ̀ pé n ó ṣe àlábàpáàdé Ìyá àgbà Saray.
translation.en: Honestly, during a trip to Shamakhi, I did not know that I would meet Grandma Saray.

translation.yo: Mo yẹ àwọn ilé tí ìporùrù ilẹ̀ ọ̀hún bà wò fínnífínní, mo sì rí àrító ohun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ níbẹ̀.
translation.en: I examined the houses affected by the earthquake, familiarized myself with the situation there.

translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ tí mo rí Ìyá àgbà Saray, àrídájú mi lórí bí àwọn ọmọ Azerbaijan ṣe ṣ'èèyàn sí l'ékún sí i.
translation.en: When I saw Grandma Saray, I was once again convinced of how great the people of Azerbaijan were.

translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ wa á máa mú ìwúrí báni.
translation.en: We can be proud of our people.

translation.yo: Ó wà nínú ìṣòro; ilée rẹ̀ ti wó.
translation.en: She was in a difficult situation; her house was destroyed.

translation.yo: Ó jọ pé kò mọ̀ pé ẹnìkan yóò wá ṣe ìrànwọ́ fún òun.
translation.en: She probably did not even know that someone would come to her aid.

translation.yo: Kò mọ̀ bóyá ilé òun yóò dí àtúnkọ́ tàbí wọn yóò dà á wó pátápátá kọ́ òmíràn.
translation.en: She did not know whether her house would be repaired or a new house would be built.

translation.yo: Àwọn ìyá àgbà bíi Saray ní ẹ̀mí ìforítì òun ìlọra tí ó mú àwọn ọmọ Orílẹ̀ Azerbaijan yàtọ̀.
translation.en: Grandmothers like Saray are the embodiment of the unbending spirit of the Azerbaijani people.

translation.yo: Oníròyìn aládàádúró mìíràn, Sevinc Osmangizi, fi ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ìpè kan ní oríi YouTube tí ó ń pè fún ìda-ọ̀rọ̀-wo lórí ìfọ̀rọ̀wáni-lẹ́nuwo ọ̀hún lẹ́yìn tí Ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ parí.
translation.en: Another independent journalist, Sevinc Osmangizi, staged a call in canvassing reactions to the interview on YouTube immediately after the interview was broadcast.

translation.yo: Àwọn tí wọ́n wò ó sọ àwọn nǹkan tí kò tẹ́ wọn lọ́run, wón sì tún pè fún àyípadà.
translation.en: Viewers mostly registered their disappointment and called for change.

translation.yo: Ọ̀kan ní:
translation.en: One said:

translation.yo: N kò le è wo ìfọ̀rọ̀wọ́rọ̀ náà ju ibi mo wò ó dé lọ, mo sì pa ẹ̀rọ amóhùn-máwòrán.
translation.en: I could not watch the interview any longer and I turned off the television.

translation.yo: Nítorí pé, òfé lásán ni olùbéèrè Mirshahin Aghayev àti ìbéèrè rẹ̀.
translation.en: Because both the interviewer Mirshahin Aghayev and his questions were very fake.

translation.yo: Àdéhùn wọn kò wúlò fún wa mọ́.
translation.en: Their promises to us is no longer matter.

translation.yo: Èké àti irọ́ wọn ti sú àwọn èèyàn.
translation.en: Because people are now tired of such frauds and lies.

translation.yo: Àwọn ará ìlú ń fẹ́ ohun tuntun àti àtúntò tòótọ́.
translation.en: People want innovations and real reforms.

translation.yo: Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́bìrin kan tí ó jẹ́ ọmọ Tibet-Canada rí ìkọlu lórí ayélujára lẹ́yìn tí ó já ewé olú borí nínú ìdìbò àjọ-ìgbìmọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
translation.en: A Tibetan-Canadian student was attacked online after winning student council elections.

translation.yo: Ó rò pé, Beijing ló yẹ á bá wí.
translation.en: She thinks Beijing is to blame.

translation.yo: Àwòrán wá láti ọwọ́ọ Chemi Lhamo láti ìbáwọlé The Stand News.
translation.en: Image from Chemi Lhamo Instagram via The Stand News.

translation.yo: Leung Hoi Ching ni ó kọ́kọ́ kọ ìròyìn yìí tí a sì tẹ̀jáde ní èdèe Chinese lórí ilé ìgbéròyìn jáde ará ìlú Hong Kong, The Stand News ní ọjọ́ karùn-ún-dínlógún, Oṣù Èrèlé, ọdún-un 2019.
translation.en: This article was originally written by Leung Hoi Ching and published in Chinese on Hong Kong based citizen media, the Stand News on February 15, 2018.

translation.yo: Zhao Yunlin ni ó tú ìmọ̀ọ rẹ̀ sí èdèe Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.
translation.en: The following trimmed English version is translated by Zhao Yunlin.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ kẹsàn-án Oṣù Èrélé, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ti Ifáfitì Toronto, ọgbà Scarborough dìbò yan ọmọ ọdún méjìlél'ógún kan tí ìlú abínibíi rẹ̀ jẹ́ Tibet, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ààrẹ ìgbìmọ̀ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́.
translation.en: On February 9, students at the University of Toronto's Scarborough Campus elected Chemi Lhamo, a 22-year-old student of Tibetan origin, as their student council president.

translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ọjọ́ mélòó kan tí a kéde èsì ìdìbò ọ̀hún, ogunlọ́gọ̀ àwọn ọmọ China tí wọ́n ń kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ l'ókè òkun fi òǹtẹ̀ lu àpilẹ̀kọ ìfi-èhónú kan ní orí ẹ̀rọ-ayélujára, tí wọ́n sì ń t'ọ́ka àbùkù sí Lhamo pé ó ń l'ẹ̀díàpòpọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn àjọ tó ń jà fún òmìnira Tibet.
translation.en: Just days after the election results were announced, thousands of mainland Chinese overseas students signed an online petition of protest, accusing Lhamo of having close associations with pro-Tibet independence organizations.

translation.yo: Wọn rọ àwọn aláṣẹ ilé-ìwé ọ̀hún láti yọ ọ́ kúrò l'órí òye náà.
translation.en: They demanded the school disqualify her from the elected position.

translation.yo: Kòbákùngbé ìfèsì ọ̀rọ̀ láti ẹnu àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ó ń gbé ní òkè òkun gbùngbùn òkè-odò China.
translation.en: Demeaning comments from overseas mainland Chinese students

translation.yo: Ìṣàmúlò ẹ̀rọ-alátagbàa ti Lhamo kún fún àwọn kòbákùngbé ìjábọ̀-ọ̀rọ̀ àti èyí tí ó ń pè fún ìwàa jàgídíjàgan, èyí tí kò ṣẹ̀yìn àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ òkè-òkun tí ó ń gbé gbùngbùn China.
translation.en: Lhamo’s personal social account was flooded with demeaning comments and veiled threats of violence from overseas students who appeared to be from mainland China.

translation.yo: Bí àwọn ilé ìgbéròyìn sáfẹ́fẹ́ àgbàńlá-ayé gbogbo ṣe tán ìròyìn-in rẹ̀ ká, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ó wà láti Hong Kong àti Taiwan gbìnnàyá láti gbéjàa Lhamo.
translation.en: As her story began to make headlines in international media outlets, students from Hong Kong and Taiwan fired back in defense Lhamo's defense.

translation.yo: Nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wáni-lẹ́nuwo orí ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ pẹ̀lú Stand News, Chemi Lhamo sọ pé òun nígbàgbọ́ pé ohun tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀ kò sẹ́yìn àwọn àjọ tí wọ́n ń bá Ìjọba China ṣe, ẹ̀sùn èyí tí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ àgbà àjọ ọba China ti sẹ́ lé lórí.
translation.en: In a phone interview with Stand News, Chemi Lhamo said she believed that the incident was mobilized by organizations associated with Chinese government, an accusation that Chinese officials have denied.

translation.yo: Kí a tó dìbò yìí, a ti yàn mí gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbá-kejì ààrẹ ìgbìmọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ fún oṣù mẹ́jọ gbáko, kò sì sí ohun kan tí ó ṣẹlẹ̀.
translation.en: Before this election, I had already been elected as vice-president of the student council for eight whole months and nothing ever happened.

translation.yo: Ní ìdakèjì, lẹ́yìn gbogbo ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ẹ pàjáwìrì wọ̀nyìí, kò sí àní-àní pé àjọ kan ń gbìyànjú láti tìka bọ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ wọ̀nwọ̀nyí ní bírípó.
translation.en: However, after all these sudden events, you cannot help but think that there is an organization manipulating these events behind the scenes.

translation.yo: Ó pani lẹ́rìn-ín pé láti ìgbà yìí wá tí mo ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbá-kejì ààrẹ, bí mo ti ṣe ń ṣe ètò oríṣiríṣi tí n ò sì yé fi àwọn àṣàyàn ìhùwàsí mi l'éde, ṣùgbọ́n kò sí ẹni tí ó ti wádìí nípa àwọn ọ̀nà òṣèlú tí mo yàn ní ààyò.
translation.en: It’s really funny how I’ve been serving as a vice-president for so long, how I’ve organized many events and never held back from expressing my ideals, but nobody has ever asked me about my political opinions.

translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀ síwájú sí i pé ìwà àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ akẹgbẹ́ òun láti gbùngbùn China tí ń yí padà.
translation.en: She also said that her fellow students from mainland China began to behave strangely.

translation.yo: Ọ̀kàn nínú àwọn akẹgbẹ́ẹ rẹ̀ tí ó wá láti gbùngbùn China fi ìwàǹwara pè é níjà láti fi èrò rẹ s'óde lórí gbígba òmìnira Tibet.
translation.en: One of Lhamo’s classmates from mainland China spontaneously asked her, via mobile message, to draft a statement regarding Tibetan independence.

translation.yo: Ó tún gba àwọn ìpè kan, èyí tí ó ń kọ "orin pupa" (orin ọ̀tẹ̀ tí ó ń yín Ẹgbẹ́ Òṣèlú Chinese Communist Party).
translation.en: She also received phone calls playing "red songs" (propaganda songs praising the Chinese Communist Party).

translation.yo: Àwọn orin wọ̀nyìí kò yé Lhamo, bó ṣe jẹ́ pé kò mọ èdèe Mandarin Ilẹ̀ China sọ.
translation.en: Lhamo could not understand these songs, as she does not speak Mandarin Chinese.

translation.yo: Bí àkànlù àtakò àti ìjàbọ̀ ṣe ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lórí ayélujára, àpapọ̀ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ kan tí gbógun lọ sí ọ́fíìsì ìgbìmọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ láti lọ pè fún gbígbé èsì ìdìbò ọ̀hún yẹ̀wò.
translation.en: Alongside the joint attacks and the comments on the internet, a group of students went to the student council office to demand that the election results be reconsidered.

translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ sì ti ti ìyàrá ìpàdée wọn pa fún ìgbà díẹ̀, nítorí ọ̀rọ̀ àbò.
translation.en: The campus student council has now temporarily closed its conference room, for safety reasons.

translation.yo: Chemi Lhamo ti jẹ́ ajàjàǹgbara akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ fún ọdún mélòó kan.
translation.en: Chemi Lhamo has been a student activist for some years.

translation.yo: Ó jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tó ní áápọn ní ìlú àjọgbé àwọn Tibet tí ó wà ní Toronto àti pé ó ti kópa nínú ìjàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ kan tí ó wáyé níta Akànkọ́ Ilé Ẹ̀kọ́ Confucius tí fáfitì ọ̀hún, ẹ̀ka ìbílẹ̀ àjọ ìsọdọ̀kan àṣà Ilẹ̀ China tí ìjọba China ń ṣe agbátẹrù fún lọ́nà tí ó fi ń mú kí China lágbára sí i ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.
translation.en: She is an active member of the Tibetan community in Toronto and once joined a protest outside the university's Confucius Institute, the local branch of a global network of Chinese cultural institutions that are sponsored by the Chinese government and intended to promote China's soft power overseas.

translation.yo: Ní ìgbà yìí wá, ó ti fi èrò ọkàn-an rẹ̀ hàn pẹ̀lú àwọn ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ ìlú láti Hong Kong àti Taiwan lórí kókó ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ̀, òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ, ìdá-gbé nǹkan ṣe, ìjọba àwarawa àti àwọn kókó tó jọ mọ́ ọ ní ìpàdé ìta gbangba.
translation.en: In recent years, she has also exchanged views with social activists from Hong Kong and Taiwan on topics related to freedom of speech, self-determination, democracy and related topics at public events.

translation.yo: Lhamo ò fi ìgbà kan bẹ̀rù láti sọ èrò ọkàn-an rẹ̀ jáde rí tàbí fi ara rẹ̀ hàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ Tibet- ó má ń wọ Chuba, aṣọ ìbílẹ̀ àwọn ọmọ Tibet, ní gbogbo ọjọ́ Ọjọ́rú.
translation.en: Lhamo has never been afraid to speak up or show her Tibetan identity – she wears a Chuba, the traditional Tibetan dress, every Wednesday.

translation.yo: Títí di ìgbà ìdìbò, kò gbó-òórùn inúnibíni kán rí láti ọ̀dọ àwọn akẹgbẹ́ẹ rẹ̀ tí wọ́n jẹ́ ọmọ China.
translation.en: Until the election, she had never perceived any animosity from her Chinese classmates.

translation.yo: Èyí ni ó mú u fura pé ìkoni síta bíi ọmọ ọjọ́ mẹ́jọ yìí kò sẹ́yìn àwọn aláṣẹ China.
translation.en: This is what led her to worry that this barrage of harassment was instigated by Chinese authorities.

translation.yo: Láti èèyàn ogúnléndé aláìníbùgbé sí olórí ìgbìmọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́
translation.en: From stateless refugee to student council president

translation.yo: Kí ó tó rin ìrìnàjò lọ sí Canada ní ọmọ ọdún mọ́kànlá , Chemi Lhamo jẹ́ ẹni ogúnléndé tí kò rí ibùgbé kan gbé ní India.
translation.en: Before immigrating to Canada at 11 years of age, Chemi Lhamo was a stateless refugee residing in India. Her grandparents were forced into exile along with the Dalai Lama in 1959.

translation.yo: Àwọn òbíi rẹ̀ àgbà sá kúrò ní ilẹ̀ẹ wọn pẹ̀lú Dalai Lama ní ọdún-un 1959. Nínú hàhámọ́ ìnira tí wọ́n wà yìí, kò sí ibi tí òun àti mọ̀lẹ́bí rẹ̀ lọ, tí wọ́n kà wọ́n kún.
translation.en: Within these rigid borders, no matter where she and her family went, they were looked down upon.

translation.yo: Nígbàkúùgbà tí wọ́n bá bí mí léèrè pé : "Ibo lo ti wá?"
translation.en: Every time someone asks me: "Where are you from?"

translation.yo: Ara mi máa ń kótì láti dáhùn – Ìgbà mìíràn mà á pé India ni mo ti wá, ṣùgbọ́n wọn kò fún mi ní ìwé ìgbèlùú; nígbà mìíràn ẹ̀wẹ̀ mà á dáhùn pé Tibet ni mo ti wá, ṣùgbọ́n tí wọ́n bá béèrè pé báwo ni Tibet ṣe rí, n ò mọ bí n ó ṣe dáhùn-un rẹ̀, ìdí ni pé China ò fún mi ní ìwé ìgbèlùú lọ sí Tibet.
translation.en: I always end up struggling to answer – I sometimes say that I’m from India, but I was denied citizenship status there; sometimes I say that I’m from Tibet, but when they ask me how Tibet is like, I really don’t know how to answer, because the Chinese embassy won’t even issue me a visa to go to Tibet.

translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ìrírí mi bí wọ́n ṣe ń rí mi bíi atọ̀húnrìnwá ti jẹ́ kí n ní ìmọ̀ nípa àṣà àwọn èèyàn mi: àṣà Tibet.
translation.en: But it’s this experience of being viewed as an outsider that has made me understand my people’s culture better: the Tibetan culture.

translation.yo: Llamo sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìrìnàjòo rẹ̀ lọ sí Canada, ọmọ kékeré akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tuntun kan tí ó wá láti Tibet tí ó bá wá sí ìyàrá ìkẹ́ẹ̀kọ̀ọ́.
translation.en: Lhamo recounted that when she had just immigrated to Canada, a new kid from Tibet unexpectedly came to class.

translation.yo: Ara rẹ̀ yá gágá, inú rẹ̀ dùn láti ṣe alábàpàdé àwọn ọ̀rẹ́ tí ó wá láti ilẹ̀ẹ rẹ̀, bẹ́ẹ̀ ló mọ̀ pé ó lé sọ èdè Tibet.
translation.en: She was excited and happy to have found someone from her own land to become friends with, and she knew that he could speak the Tibetan language.

translation.yo: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, nínú ìfún-ojúpọ̀, ó sọ fún un pé: “Tí a kò bá sọ èdè Tibet ńkọ́ ?
translation.en: However, frowning at her, he told her: “How about we don’t speak Tibetan?

translation.yo: Mo lè sọ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.”
translation.en: I can speak English.”

translation.yo: N ò mọ̀ bóyá ojú ń tì í ni tàbí ẹ̀rí ọkàn ń jẹ́ ẹ.
translation.en: I don’t know if he was either ashamed or had some kind of guilt.

translation.yo: N ò mọ̀.
translation.en: I really don’t know.

translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ìgbà náà ni mo tó mọ̀ pé àwọn ọ̀dọ́ Tibet kan ò fẹ́ sọ èdè wọn bí ẹni pé wọn kàn-án nípa fún wọn láti sọ èdè elédè.
translation.en: But it was then when I realized that some young Tibetans don’t want to speak their own language as if they were being pressured to speak another language.

translation.yo: Ní ìgbà yẹn, Lhamo jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún 12.
translation.en: At the time, Lhamo was only 12 years old.

translation.yo: Ẹ̀míi rẹ̀ ò lé ‘lẹ̀ nípa ìdánimọ̀ọ rẹ̀, ó yìí ọkàn àwọn òbí rẹ̀ padà láti kó lọ sí àdúgbò tí àwọn ọmọ Tibet ń gbé.
translation.en: Feeling insecure about her identity, she convinced her parents to move back to a neighborhood with a Tibetan community.

translation.yo: Láti ìgbà náà wá, ó kọ́ nípa èdè, àṣà àti ìṣẹ̀ṣe Buddha ti Tibet, ó sì di àjà-fún-ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọ ènìyàn.
translation.en: From then on, she learned more about Tibetan language, culture and Buddhism and became an activist.

translation.yo: Àwọn àdáyanrí ìwà Tibet bíi ìní elẹgbẹ́ ẹni lọ́kàn, ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún àgbà, àìmọ̀kan ní ìpilẹ̀ ìbàjẹ́, ti fún mi ní ìgboyà.
translation.en: Tibetan values, such as be considerate, be respectful to the elderly, ignorance as the root for negativity and etc., has give me a lot of strength.

translation.yo: Bí ìmọ̀ mi ṣe ń lé kún sí i nínú àṣà ìbílẹ̀ẹ mi, ní ìgboyà mi ṣe ń pọ̀ sí i.
translation.en: And the more I understand my culture, the more confident I feel.

translation.yo: Agbára àti ìgboyà yìí, bí ó ṣe sọ, tí mú u láti lè sọ̀rọ̀ akin gẹ́gẹ́ bí atọ̀hùn-rìnwá àti ọmọ Tibet:
translation.en: This strength and confidence, she says, has enabled her to speak up as an immigrant and a Tibetan:

translation.yo: Ó le láti jẹ́ atọ̀hùn-rìnwá, ṣùgbọ́n ìjàjàǹgbara yìí ní ó sọ mí di bí mo ṣe wà.
translation.en: Being an immigrant is very difficult, but this struggle is what makes me who I am.

translation.yo: Lónìí, mò ń sọ̀rọ̀ ní ohùn ìrara nípa àwọn ará Tibet ní kíkankíkan àti ìwúrí ọlọ́pẹ́ tí ìdánimọ̀ọ mi gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ Tibet fún mi.
translation.en: Today, I speak about the Tibetan people loud and clear with pride thanks to the strength that my identity as a Tibetan gives me.

translation.yo: Nígbà tí à ń dìbò ìgbìmọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́, mo máa ń tẹnu mọ ọn pé ó yẹ kí àwọn tí wọ́n ayàsọ́tọ̀ ní aṣojú nígbà ìdìbò.
translation.en: During the student council election, I often emphasize the need for the marginalized to have their own representation during the student council elections.

translation.yo: À ń fẹ́ aṣojú tí yóò rí i wípé à ń rí ẹtọ wa gbà lóòrèkóòrè.
translation.en: We need representation so that our rights be upheld.

translation.yo: Ìjìyà yóò wá sópin
translation.en: Suffering will end

translation.yo: Fún Lhamo, ayé tí ó pé pérépéré ni èyí tí kò sí ìdálọ́wọ́kọ́ tàbí ìyàsọ́tọ̀ — Òmìnira Tibet àti ìdádúróo rẹ̀ kọ́ ni ohun tí ó hún jẹ wá lẹ́sẹ̀.
translation.en: For Lhamo, the ideal world is one without borders or boundaries — Tibetan independence and autonomy is not the real issue at stake.

translation.yo: Ìmísí ọjọ́ ọ̀la mi sí Tibet kan náà ni mo ní sì gbogbo àgbá-ńlá-ayé: Mo fẹ́ jẹ́ kí ẹ̀tọ́ tí àwọn ará Tibet ń jẹ gbádùn máà yàtọ̀ sí ti àwọn Canada, àwọn ni òmìnira láti lè sọ èrò ọkàn ẹni, òmìnira láti ní ìgbàgbọ́, òmìnira láti máà fi òṣèlú pá ẹniẹlẹ́ni lẹ́kún.
translation.en: My vision for Tibet is the same vision that I have for the whole world: I wish for Tibetan people to enjoy the same rights as Canadians, namely freedom to express themselves, freedom of belief, freedom to avoid political oppression.

translation.yo: N ò ṣe ojúṣàájú fún àwọn ará Tibet láti ní àwọn ẹ̀tọ́ wọn yìí nìkan, ó wù mí kí àwọn tí wọ́n wá láti Hong Kong àti Taiwan, ìwọ̀-oòrùn Turkey, àwọn ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ẹgbẹ̀rún ní ìlọ́po méjì 60 ẹni ogúnléndé tí ó wà ní kárí ayé àti fún gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn láti jàǹfààní ẹ̀tọ̀ wọ̀nyí.
translation.en: I don’t only wish for Tibetan people to enjoy these rights, I also wish that people from Hong Kong and Taiwan, Eastern Turks, the 60 million refugees around the world and for everyone to enjoy these rights.

translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn èèyàn láti Hong Kong ní ìgbàgbọ́ pé China tí ń lo agbára tìkúùkú, wọ́n sì ń lo ètò ìlú láti ṣẹ́ àwọn ọ̀tá àti àwọn ẹ̀yà tí kò pọ̀ lẹ́yìn.
translation.en: Many people in Hong Kong believe that China has become more authoritarian in recent years, adopting a more heavy-handed policy towards political dissidents and ethnic minorities.

translation.yo: Kódà ni Hong Kong, àyè láti sọ ọ̀rọ̀ ẹnu ẹni jáde àti láti bá èèyàn ṣe pọ̀ ti jákulẹ̀.
translation.en: Even in Hong Kong, the space for freedom of speech and association has diminished.

translation.yo: Àwọn ìpèníjà òṣèlú tí ó ń kojú wọn ní Hong Kong lẹ́yìn Àkójọpọ̀ Ẹgbẹ́ Alábùradà; 2014 Umbrella Movement kò ṣe àjòjì sí Chemi Lhamo, ṣùgbọ́n ó bá àwọn ará Hong Kong kẹ́dùn, ó pẹ̀tù sí wọn lọ́kàn pé kò kí wọ́n máà ṣe juwọ́ sílẹ̀:
translation.en: Chemi Lhamo is familiar with the political challenges faced in Hong Kong after the 2014 Umbrella movement but she shared her optimism with Hong Kong people and urged them not to give up:

translation.yo: Mo kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ kan nínú àṣà àwọn Tibet nípa àìwàfúnìgbàpípẹ́: gbogbo nǹkan ni òpin yóò dé bá. Mo ní ìgbàgbọ́ pé ìjìyà gbogbo ń bọ̀ wá dópin…Mo ní ìrètí pé ọjọ́ kan ń bọ̀ tí mo máa wọ aṣọ Chuba mi lọ sí Tibet.
translation.en: I learned a concept from the Tibetan culture known as impermanence: everything has an end and I believe that all suffering will also end…I hope that one day I’ll be able to go to Tibet wearing my Chuba.

translation.yo: Àfilé iye owó fún gbígba ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà mú àwọn ọmọ Angola fi ẹ̀hónú hàn
translation.en: A steep price hike for passport applications pushed Angolans to protest

translation.yo: Ní ibi ìfẹ̀hónúhàn ní Luanda, àmì náà sọ pé "30.500 Kwanzas kì í ṣe kékeré".
translation.en: At a protest in Luanda, the sign says "30.500 Kwanzas is a lot".

translation.yo: Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Fernando Gomes, a gba àṣẹ láti lò ó.
translation.en: Photo by Fernando Gomes, used with permission.

translation.yo: Inú ń bí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Angola látàrí iye owó ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà tuntun 30,500 kwanzas (ó tó 97 owó dollar) tí ìjọba ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ polongo ní ọjọ́ 21 oṣù Ṣẹẹrẹ.
translation.en: Angolans are enraged about the government's new passport fee of 30,500 kwanzas (around 97 US dollars), introduced on 21 January.

translation.yo: 2500 kwanzas (owó dollar orílẹ̀-èdè US mẹ́jọ) ni ó jẹ́ tẹ́lẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀.
translation.en: Previously, the fee costed 2500 kwanzas (8 US dollars).

translation.yo: Ní àfikún, ìjọba ti pín iye owó irúfẹ́ ìrìnàjò tí ó wà sí ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, ó tò ó ní ẹsẹẹsẹ.
translation.en: In addition, the government has put in place a new price scale for all types of travel.

translation.yo: Lábẹ́ ìlànà tuntun yìí ni ìjọba yóò ti máa gba 45,250 kwanzas fún ìwé ìwọ̀lú ìdúró-sí-ìlú; 21,350 fún ìwé ìwọ̀lú ìrìnàjò-afẹ́; 36,500 fún ìwé ìwọ̀lú àgbàníbodè; 38,125 fún ìsúnsíwájú ìwé ìwọ̀lú iṣẹ́; 15,250 fún ìwé ìwọ̀lú ọ̀rọ̀ ìlera ara; àti 30,500 fún ìwé pélébé ìgbélùú.
translation.en: It states that authorities will charge 45,250 kwanzas for a staying visa; 21,350 for a tourist visa; 36,500 for tourist visas given at the border; 38,125 for extensions of working visas; 15,250 for medical visas; and 30,500 for a permanent residency card.

translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ fún Ẹ̀ka Ìjọba tí ó ń ṣe àbójútó ètò ìforúkọsílẹ̀, Valdemar José, sọ fún àwọn akọ̀ròyìn ìbílẹ̀ Angola pé ìdíyelé fún ìwé ìrìnnà ìwọ̀lú lásán-làsàn lọ sí òkè nítorí owó gegere ni ó ń jẹ láti ṣe ìwé náà:
translation.en: Valdemar José, spokesperson for the Interior Ministry, told Angola Press that the price rise for ordinary passports was justified by the higher cost of producing the document:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Ìjọba rí i wípé ó tó àsìkò láti sún owó ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà, ó sì ti yọ ọwọ́ọ Kílàńkóo rẹ̀ kúrò nínú kíkó owó lé e lórí, kí ó ba lè ṣe, fún àpẹẹrẹ, pèsè omi, ináa mànàmáná àti àwọn ohun amáyérọrùn mìíràn.
translation.en: The government adjusted the real value of the passport and stopped subsidising it, giving, for example, priority to issues of water, light and products of primary necessity.

translation.yo: Ohun èlò fún ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà máa ń gbọ́n owó mì, nítorí iṣẹ́ ìdáàbòbò oríi rẹ̀, tí àjọ ọba ń kówó lé lórí tẹ́lẹ̀ kí ó tó di ìgbà yìí.
translation.en: The materials for producing passports have a higher cost, because of the security features in the documents, which until now the state subsidised.

translation.yo: Èyí jẹ́ ìrántí ohun tí ojú àwọn ọmọ Mozambique rí ní ìparí ọdún-un 2018, nígbàtí ìjọba pinnu láti fi owó kún ìwé àṣẹ gbogbo, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni ó bá ìwé àṣẹ ọkọ̀ wíwà, tí ìdíyelée rẹ̀ fi ìdá 500 gbéwó lórí.
translation.en: This is reminiscent of what Mozambicans experienced in late 2018, when the government also decided to increase the fees for legal documents, as well as for driving licenses, by 500 per cent.

translation.yo: Àfilé iye owó náà ti dá awuyewuye sílẹ̀.
translation.en: The price hike has sparked controversy.

translation.yo: Ìfẹ̀hónúhàn ọ̀dọ̀ tí ó tó bíi 100 wáyé ní ọjọ́ kẹ́rin oṣù Èrèlé, pẹ̀lú àtìlẹ́yìn ẹgbẹ́ àwọn ọmọ ìlú kan tí ó rí ìgbésẹ̀ ìjọba gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀nà láti gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé ẹ̀tọ́ àwọn ènìyàn fún ìrìnàjò ṣíṣe.
translation.en: A protest by around 100 youths took place on 4 February, and was promoted by a group of citizens who saw the government’s measure as a clear attempt to restrict people’s right to travel.

translation.yo: Ìfẹ̀hónúhàn náà
translation.en: The protest

translation.yo: Ìfẹ̀hónúhàn ní Luanda (ọjọ́ kẹrin oṣù Èrèlé).
translation.en: Protest in Luanda (4 February).

translation.yo: Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Simão Rossi, a lò ó pẹ̀lú àṣẹ.
translation.en: Photo by Simão Rossi, used with permission.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ kẹrin oṣù Èrèlé, Global Voices bá Fernando Gomes, ajìjàǹgbara ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Angola tí ó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára àwọn alátìlẹ́yìn ìfẹ̀hónúhàn náà tàkùrọ̀sọ, láti mọ ohun gbogbo tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.
translation.en: On 4 February, Global Voices spoke with Fernando Gomes, an Angolan activist and one of the promoters of the protest, to learn more of the details around the event.

translation.yo: Ó sọ fún wa:
translation.en: He told us:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Èyí [ni ọ̀nà kan] fún ìpèsí àkíyèsí ìjọba João Lourenço, wípé àfilé ìdíyelé kò yẹ nírú àsìkò yìí, nítorí owó náà ti ṣe gegere ju fún àwọn ọmọ ìlú.
translation.en: This [was the] way found to attract the attention of João Lourenço’s government, that this is not the best time to increase the price, as citizens lose purchasing power in an exponential way.

translation.yo: Àti pé "iṣẹ́ ìdàgbàsókè ọrọ̀ Ajé orílẹ̀-èdè Angola" kò lé wáyé nípasẹ̀ àfilé owó orí, nítorí wípé àwọn ọmọ ìlú ni ó ń fi orí kó o, àwọn tí ó wà ní ipò ìjọba ní àǹfààní tí ó pọ̀ ní ìkáwọ́ọ wọn, tí ó ṣe pé àpò ará ìlú tí ó ń rùnpà ni wọ́n ti ń mú owó tí wọ́n ń ná.
translation.en: And that the much alluded to "diversification of the Angolan economy" cannot occur exclusively through raising direct taxes, given that they only hit citizens, the political class has various privileges, which are paid for by the already impoverished citizens themselves.

translation.yo: Àwọn alátakò ti sọ pé ó ṣe pàtàkì láti rántí wípé ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà dúró fún ìdánimọ̀ ọmọ ìlú ní òkè òkun, torí ìdí èyí, kò ṣe é yẹ̀ sílẹ̀ fún wọn.
translation.en: Critics say that it is important to remember that a passport is a citizen’s identity document abroad and, as such, an inescapable necessity for a lot of citizens.

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: A máa wà ní ojú òpópónà ní olú ìlú fún oṣù Èrèlé, ní àwọn ọjọ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan tí a yàn, ọjọ́ kẹrin oṣù Èrèlé ni ìwọ́de náà bẹ̀rẹ̀, àmọ́ ní ọjọ́ kéje ni a máa padà sí ojú òpópónà, tí a óò tún wà ní ọjọ́ kankànlá, tí a ó sì jábọ̀ ní ọjọ́ kẹtàlá, bí ìjọba kò bá yí ohùn padà.
translation.en: We are going to be in the capital city’s streets for the whole month of February, on staggered days, 4 February was the beginning of the demonstrations, but on the 7th we will return to the streets, and again we will be there on the 11th and on the 13th we will hold a debriefing, if the government does not backtrack on the implementation of the presidential decree.

translation.yo: Àwọn akọrin ewì-alohùn ráàpù, Lilo Kwanza àti Adérito Gonçalves, kọ orin kan, tí wọ́n sì ya àwòrán-an orin tí ó dá lóríi ìwọ́de ìfẹ̀hónúhàn yìí, "Ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà 30,000" ni àkọlé orin náà, tí ó ń ṣe ẹ̀fẹ̀ lórí iye owó tabua tí ọmọ-ìlú yóò san fún ìwé ìrìnnà.
translation.en: Two young rappers, Lilo Kwanza and Adérito Gonçalves, made a song and video about this protest movement, with the title "Passport for 30 thousand", ironically commenting on the costs of the document to citizens.

translation.yo: Ó ku ọjọ́ díẹ̀ kí ìwọ́de náà ó kò, ajàfúnẹ̀tọ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Angola Pedrowski Teca sọ wípé ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnná pọn dandan ju ìwé ìdánimọ̀ pélébé lọ, ó rọ àwọn ènìyàn láti kọ́wọ̀ọ́ rìn, nítorí àìkọ́wọ̀ọ́ rìn, ní í ṣe ikú pa ọmọ ejò:
translation.en: Days before the demonstration, the Angolan activist Pedrowski Teca said that the passport is more important than the identity card, asking people to join the protest:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Àwọn àjọ àgbáyé ti dẹ̀yìn kọ Òfin Ìṣíkúrò tí ó pàṣẹ àfilé ìdíyelé tí ó gbéra nílẹ̀ fìrì tí ó sì lọ òkè lálá.
translation.en: International demonstration against the absurd rise in the prices in Migration Acts.

translation.yo: OBS: Ìwé ìdánimọ̀ pélébé (B.I) wúlò gẹ́gẹ́ bí àmì ìdánimọ̀ ní àárín ìlú Angola.
translation.en: OBS: The identity card (B.I) only identifies an Angolan within national territory.

translation.yo: Ní ẹ̀yìn odi ìlú Angola, pánda tí kò wúlò ni ìwé ìdánimọ̀ pélébé, kò sí àmì ìdánimọ̀ kan tí ó wà bí kò ṣe ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà.
translation.en: Outside Angola, the identity card is useless, as the only valid identification document is a passport.

translation.yo: Àwa, tí a wà nínú ìlú, ni a ó fi ààbò bò tí a ó sì ké pe àwọn aráa wa ní òkè òkun, kí àwọn náà ó ké gbàjarè, nítorí ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnà ṣe kókó fún wọn.
translation.en: We, inside the country, are going to protect and call on our compatriots in the diaspora to follow the same path, as the passport is more useful for them.

translation.yo: Kí ìròyìn náà ó ba hó ye létí àwọn ènìyàn, ajàfúnẹ̀tọ́ọ nì àti akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Ifáfitì, David Mendes, kọ, ní ọjọ́ ìwọ́de náà, iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ fún ààre orílẹ̀-èdè Angola João Lourenço:
translation.en: To amplify the message, the activist and university student, David Mendes, wrote, on the day of the demonstration, a message for the Angolan president João Lourenço:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Ọmọ-ẹgbẹ́ ààrẹ João Lourenço, kì í ṣe nítorí èyí ni àwọn aráa Angola ṣe yàn ọ́ sípò, kò sí ibi tí o ti sọ nínú ìpolongo ìléríi rẹ, o kò sọ pé ìwé ẹ̀rí yóò gbówó lórí, síbẹ̀ kí ni ò ń rò?
translation.en: Comrade president João Lourenço, it was not for this that the Angolan people voted for you, in no moment of your campaigns did you spoke about a change of price of document, after all what are you thinking?

translation.yo: Kí ni ẹ fi ṣe ohùn àwọn mẹ̀kúnnù?
translation.en: Where is the voice of the people?

translation.yo: A ti rí ìrora látàrí àwọn àfilé ìdíyelé, ǹjẹ́ o mọ ìṣòro tí ó ń fà fún àwọn ará ìlú?
translation.en: We already have a miserable life with these price rises, do you have an idea of the difficulty that you are causing for the people?

translation.yo: A kò tilẹ̀ mọ ẹni náà tí ó tọ́ láti tukọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè Angola, báwo ni ọ̀dọ́ tí kò níṣẹ́ tí kò lábọ̀ yóò ṣe rí owó gba ìwé ẹ̀rí?
translation.en: We sincerely do not know who is the right man to govern our Angola, how will a youth who has no job find the money to get the documents?

translation.yo: Pẹ̀lú gbogbo rẹ̀, ìjọba kò ì tíì sọ tó, tàbí kí ó kéde láti sọ bóyá òun yóò mú ìdíyelé náà wálẹ̀.
translation.en: So far, the government has not reacted publicly, nor announced if it would consider reducing the price of passport.

translation.yo: Àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Òmìnira ní Trinidad àti Tobago — àmọ́ ǹjẹ́ orílẹ̀-èdè náà ní òmìnira bí?
translation.en: It's Emancipation Day in Trinidad & Tobago — but is the country free?

translation.yo: Citizens examine what stands in the way of true freedom
translation.en: Citizens examine what stands in the way of true freedom

translation.yo: Ère Orin Ìràpadà, Ọgbà Òmìnira, Jamaica. Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Mark Franco, a gba àṣẹ láti lò ó.
translation.en: Redemption Song Statue, Emancipation Park, Jamaica. Photo by Mark Franco, used with permission.

translation.yo: Ọjọ́ 1 oṣù Ògún ni ọ̀pọ̀ agbègbè tí ó wà ní Caribbean mọ̀ sí Àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Òmìnira, tí í ṣe ọjọ́ tí a máa ń sààmi ìgbòmìnira àwọn ọmọ Adúláwọ̀ t'ó jìyà ní àsìkò okòwò ẹrú orí òkun atlantic.
translation.en: August 1 is celebrated in many Caribbean territories as Emancipation Day, marking the freedom of enslaved Africans who were victims of the transatlantic slave trade.

translation.yo: Trinidad àti Tobago jẹ́ àkọ́kọ́ nínú àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè ní àgbáyé tí yóò ya ọjọ́ sọ́tọ̀ láti fi sọríi ìfòpin sí òwò ẹrú, àmọ́ lẹ́yìn-in 34 ọdún tí ìsinmi àpapọ̀ náà fi ẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ àti ọdún 185 lẹ́yìn-in tí Àbá òfin Ìfòpin sówò-ẹrú kọ́kọ́ wáyé, awuyewuye ṣì ń lọ lóríi wípé bóyá erékùṣù-ìbejì olómìnira náà ní òmìnira tàbí kò ní.
translation.en: Trinidad and Tobago was the first country in the world to declare a national holiday to mark the abolition of slavery, but 34 years after that first public holiday was instituted and 185 years after the Slavery Abolition Act first came into effect, great discussion continues over whether or not the twin-island republic is emancipated.

translation.yo: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ọ rẹ̀ nípa òmìnira ní ọjọ́ 27, ọdún-un, Alákòóso Ìlú Dókítà. Keith Rowley ṣàkíyèsí wípé ní àárín àwọn ọmọ bíbíi Trinidad àti Tobago, àwọn tí ó jẹ́ ọmọ Adúláwọ̀ "kol ṣe dáadáa tó bí ó ṣe yẹ".
translation.en: Speaking about the issue on July 27, 2019, Prime Minister Dr. Keith Rowley observed that among Trinidad and Tobago's diverse population, people of African descent "are not doing as well as we expected".

translation.yo: Rowley sọ wípé ìwà-ipá tí í ṣe ti ènìyàn dúdú, ìrírí ọ̀dọ̀, ní láti máa ṣe ìwúrí fún àwọn ọmọìlú láti "fiyèsí, ṣe àfihàn àti ṣe ìtàkùrọ̀sọ pàtàkì nípa ibi tí a wà gẹ́gẹ́ bí orílẹ̀-èdè".
translation.en: Rowley said that rising levels of violence which are part of the black, urban youth experience, should be inspiring citizens to "focus, reflect and have serious conversations about where we are as a nation".

translation.yo: Alága Ìgbìmọ̀ Àtìlẹ́yìn Òmìnira ti orílẹ̀-èdè náà, Khafra Khambon, gbà.
translation.en: Chairman of the country's Emancipation Support Committee, Khafra Khambon, agreed.

translation.yo: Àwọn ìwé àpilẹ̀kọ kan sí olóòtú fi àwọn àpẹẹrẹ okòwò ẹrú ìgbàlódé láwùjọ hàn èyí tí ó fi hàn wípé òmìnira tòòtọ́ ṣì ku díẹ̀ káàtó, nígbà tí àwọn mìíràn gbìyànjú láti sọ ọ́ di ọ̀rọ̀ òṣèlú, bí wọ́n ṣe ń tako àwọn iṣẹ́ ìlú àti àṣà.
translation.en: Some letters to the editor gave examples of modern slavery to make the point that true emancipation still seems a long way off, while others tried to make the occasion a political one, by criticising certain social services and a culture of “handouts.”

translation.yo: Ìwé ìròyìn Trinidad Express yàn láti kọ èròo rẹ̀ nípa Àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Òmìnira tí ó dábàá wípé Rowley, Kambon, àti ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ ọmọ-ènìyàn Pearl Eintou Springer ṣì sọ nígbàtí wọ́n sọ ìdí tí àwọn ọmọìlú Trinidad àti Tobago tí ó jẹ́ ènìyàn dúdú ò fi ṣe dáadáa tó:
translation.en: The Trinidad Express chose to feature an opinion on Emancipation Day which suggested that Rowley, Kambon, and activist Pearl Eintou Springer were wrong about why some Afro-Trinbagonians may be underperforming:

translation.yo: Ó rọrùn fún ẹgbẹ́ tí ó dúró ṣinṣin láti dá ètòo ẹlẹ́yàmẹyà àti ìtẹ̀bọlẹ̀.
translation.en: It is easy for a dominant group to create a system that discriminates and subjugates.

translation.yo: Àwọn tí kò bá ètò náà lọ yóò di aláìṣetó tí wọ́n á sì di ẹni àgbésẹ́yìn sí ipò kejì tàbí èyí tí ó burú ju bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
translation.en: Those who do not measure up to that system are categorised as under-performers and relegated to second class or worse.

translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ètòo wa, ẹ̀kọ́ tí í ṣe baba, ń gbé àwọn ènìyàn sí ipòo tálákà, kò sì fún wọn ní àǹfààní lẹ́ẹ̀kan sí i.
translation.en: So many of our systems, education the leader, put people unfairly in a caste and they are not given a second chance.

translation.yo: Gbogbo ètò ni ó ní òṣùwọ̀n, tí ó ṣì jìnà gbégbérégbé sí òkè.
translation.en: Every system has a rating and the further away it is from the top, the lower the ranking.

translation.yo: Àwọn tó bá ara wọn ní ìsàlẹ̀ ní ìṣòro láti bá àwọn tí ó wà ní òkè ṣe.
translation.en: Those who find themselves on the bottom rung have great difficulty coping with the elevated systems.

translation.yo: Iyì-ara-ẹni máa ń relẹ̀, tí èyí yóò sì mú wọn hu ìwà-ipá láti jà fún ẹ̀tọ́ọ wọn láwùjọ.
translation.en: Self-esteem is low and in their perceived helplessness may even drive them to employ violence to counter-punch suppression.

translation.yo: Ajábọ̀-ìròyín Arthur Dash gbóríyìn fún “ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-àtẹ̀yìnwá ìdàgbàsókè” orílẹ̀-èdè náà ní ti ọ̀ràn-an ẹ̀yà, àmọ́ ó tún dá àbá wípé ìṣòro náà ju bí àwọn ti ṣe rò lọ, ó sì mú u ní àbá pé ó yẹ kí ọ̀rọ̀ alákòóso ìlú jẹ́ ìwúrí fún ọmọìlú láti ṣe ìwádìí fínnífínní sí bí ẹlẹ́yàmẹyà nínú ilé-iṣẹ ṣe ń pín àwọn ènìyàn sọ́tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.
translation.en: Commentator Arthur Dash lauded the country's “commendable history of maturity” when it comes to discussing race-related issues, but he also suggested the problem lay deeper, within the system itself, and suggested the prime minister's message should motivate citizens to examine how institutional racism continues to be a restrictive force.

translation.yo: Àwọn òǹlò ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà sọ ti wọn. Òǹlò Facebook Adrian Raymond sọ:
translation.en: Social media users shared their musings as well. In a public post, Facebook user Adrian Raymond said:

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ òní a ṣe ìrántí àti ìsààmì òmìnira àwọn babańláa wa nínú ìgbèkùn ara ti òwò ẹrú.
translation.en: On this day we remember and commemorate the freedom of our ancestors from the physical bondage of slavery.

translation.yo: Ní òní, lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún, àwa ọmọ ẹrú tí à ń jà fitafita fún àjogúnbá ìjọba amúnisìn.
translation.en: Today, many generations later, we the decendants [sic] of slaves struggle with the legacies left by colonialism.

translation.yo: Àwọn àjogúnbá tí ó gbèèrú àti tí ó ní ìmúgbòrò ti di gbẹndẹ́kẹ: A ò kí ń ṣe òǹrorò, a ò kí ń ṣe oníjàgídíjàgan, a ò kí ń ṣe apanijẹ, a ò kàn kí ń ṣe ọ̀daràn àti ọmọ-ìta.
translation.en: Legacies which thrive and are perpetuated by stereotypes: We are not savage, we are not violent, we are not predators, we are not just thugs and gangsters.

translation.yo: Olórí ni wa, aronújinlẹ̀ ni wa, ọlọ́pọlọ pípé ni wa, onímọ̀ ni wa.
translation.en: We are leaders, revolutionary thinkers, visionaries, philosophers.

translation.yo: Obama ni wá, Garvey ni wa, Marley ni wa, Angelou ni wa, Walcott ni wa.
translation.en: We are Obama, Garvey, Marley, Angelou, Walcott.

translation.yo: Ẹ jẹ́ ká mọ̀ wípé ìyàsọ́tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ nípa ti àwọ̀ ara ni ogún tí ó ń pín wa níyà.
translation.en: Let us recognize that colourism is an inherited tool used to divide us.

translation.yo: Ẹ jẹ́ kí á ṣe ìṣèlú tó kún fún ọ̀wọ̀; ẹ dẹ́kun à ń ba dúdú jẹ́ ní etí àwọn ènìyàn...
translation.en: Let us call out respectability politics: a culture of dilution; stop playing down blackness to make it palatable to the masses...

translation.yo: Ẹ jẹ́ ká ṣ’àjọyọ̀ àtúnrí àwọn ìgbàgbọ́ọ wa.
translation.en: Let us celebrate the rediscovery of our faith and belief systems.

translation.yo: Wọ́n gba ẹ̀sìn àwọn babańláa wa, wọ́n mú ìgbàgbọ́ àti ohun iyìi wa kúrò ní ọkàn-an wa.
translation.en: They took away the religion of our ancestors, they took away a belief system and sense of values.

translation.yo: Ní ayé òde òní tí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára mú iṣẹ́ ìwádìí rọrùn, ó yẹ kí o ṣe àyẹ̀wò sí ìgbàgbọ́ àwọn babańláa wa, ìbọ̀wọ̀ àti ìmọrírì àgbà, gbígba ìwùsàsí ẹni ìtẹnumọ́ ẹwùn àti èrè ìwà ẹni, ìgbàgbọ́ ń bẹ nínú ẹbí, nínúu mọ̀lẹ́bí, nínú ìletò, nínúu àdúgbó.
translation.en: In today's world of information access you owe it to yourself to explore the belief systems of our ancestors, the reverence and honouring of the elders, the owning of one's actions an emphasis on choice and consequence, there is belief in the family, the extended family, the village, the community.

translation.yo: Òmìnira yìí faramọ́ ẹni tí o jẹ́, ibi tí o ti ṣẹ̀ wá, ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-àtẹ̀yìwá tí ó wà nínú iṣan-ẹ̀jẹ̀.
translation.en: This emancipation embrace the fullness and richness of who you are, where you came from, the blood and history that's in your veins.

translation.yo: Gbá iyìi rẹ̀ mú, àṣàà rẹ, àti ìdánimọ̀ọ rẹ.
translation.en: Own with pride who you are, your culture, your identity.

translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ Bangladeshi lo ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà fi gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ àìsàn ibà-ẹ̀fọn
translation.en: Bangladeshis use social media to tackle a dengue outbreak

translation.yo: Ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ l’ó ń d'orí kọ ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà lọ láti gba ẹ̀jẹ̀
translation.en: Many are resorting to social media to collect blood

translation.yo: Ẹ̀fọn Aedes albopictus, tí ó máa ń gbé kòkòrò ibà ká.
translation.en: Aedes albopictus mosquito, a carrier of Dengue fever.

translation.yo: Àwòrán láti oríi Wikipedia, James Gathany, CDC ni ó ni àwòrán, àwòrán Òde.
translation.en: Image via Wikipedia by James Gathany, CDC. Public Domain.

translation.yo: Ní àárín ọdún, mélòó kan tí ó kọjá, pàápàá ní àsìkò ìjì ọdọọdún monsoon, iye àwọn tí àìsàn-an ibàa ẹ̀fọn ti kọlù ní Bangladeshì ti lékún síi.
translation.en: In the past few years, especially during the monsoon season, the number of dengue fever cases has risen in Bangladesh.

translation.yo: Ní ọdún yìí, àwọn tí àìsàn-an ibàá kọlù tó bíi 7,179, àwọn - 2800 ní sáà kínní osùu Agẹmọ nìkan.
translation.en: This year, it took an alarming turn with a total of 7,179 cases recorded – nearly 2800 of them from the first half of July alone.

translation.yo: Bí ètò ìjọba ò ṣe dántọ́ tó láti borí àjàkálẹ̀ àìsàn ibà tí ó gbòde yìí, àwọn ènìyàn ń gbẹ́kẹ̀le ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà láti fi sọ ẹ̀dùn-un ọkàn-an wọn, pín àlàyé nípa ìtànkálẹ̀ kòkòrò náà, àti ṣe ìkéde nípa bí àwọn ènìyán ṣe le dá ààbò bo ara wọn.
translation.en: As government resources are seemingly overwhelmed by the severity of this recent spike in dengue cases, people are turning to social media to voice their complaints, share information about the spread of the virus, and to spread awareness about how people can protect themselves.

translation.yo: Àkọsílẹ̀ Àìsàn Pọ̀ Sí i Ní Osù Agẹmọ
translation.en: Record highs in July

translation.yo: Ilé ìwòsàn gba àwọn aláìsàn ibà ẹ̀fọn 403 tí ó pọ̀ jù lọ ní ọjọ́ 22 osù Agẹmọ.
translation.en: 22 July saw record highs as 403 new dengue patients were admitted to hospitals in a 24-hour period.

translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn onímọ̀ kan ṣe rò, ipa ìyípadà ojú-ọjọ́, òjò àìdágbá kan, ojú-ọjọ́ tó ń ṣe ségesège, àti àìṣèmọ́tótó ni ọ̀dádá tí ó ń dá àtànkálẹ̀ ibà sílẹ̀.
translation.en: According to some experts, the effects of climate change, intermittent rain, unusual weather patterns, and lack of cleanliness are the main culprits for the rise in dengue cases.

translation.yo: Àwọn mìíràn sọ wípé ibà ẹ̀fọn ti ọdún nìí ń ṣekú paon ju ti ẹ̀yìn wá lọ. Ní ti òǹlò Twitter Md. Saif:
translation.en: Others also shared that this year's strain of the dengue virus is deadlier than in previous years. According to Twitter user Md. Saif:

translation.yo: "Ibà-ẹ̀fọn àti àmìi rẹ̀ ní ọdún yìí ti yàtọ̀ nítorí ìdí èyí ni o fi ní láti tọ oníṣègùn rẹ̀ lọ ní kété tí o bá ti ní ibà náà" – gẹ́gẹ́ bí ògbólògbó onímọ̀ ìlera ti Ilé-ìwòsàn Bangabandhu ti sọ.
translation.en: "This year the strain and symptom of the disease have changed so you need to go to your doctor immediately after catching the fever" – according to an expert physician at the Bangabandhu Medical Hospital.

translation.yo: Àwọn ẹ̀yà ara àwọn aláìsàn tí amodi tẹ̀ ti ń daṣẹ́ sílẹ̀ – a kò gbọ́ èyí rí.
translation.en: Severely affected patients are having multiple organ failure – this was unheard of in the previous years.

translation.yo: Nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò pẹ̀lú ìwé ìròyìn Bangla Tribune, Dókítà Gulzar sọ wípé kò sí bí a ṣe lè wo ibà ẹ̀fọn yìí nígbà àkọ́kọ́ tó, kí ó máà tún ṣeni lẹ́ẹ̀ẹkejì.
translation.en: In an interview with the Bangla Tribune, Dr. Gulzar said that people who were previously infected with dengue have a greater risk of reinfection.

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Ibà-ẹ̀fọn ti ọdún yìí jẹ́ tuntun, ó sì yára pa ènìyàn.
translation.en: This year Dengue has a new strain, deadlier.

translation.yo: Ó sì ń fa àmì ìfòyà.
translation.en: It is inducing Dengue shock syndrome.

translation.yo: Ohun tí ó lè fà á lè pọ̀ – ọ̀pọ̀ ni ó kó àìsàn ní ọdún tí ó kọjá, tí wọn kò fura.
translation.en: There may be another cause – many were infected in the previous years, many perhaps did not notice.

translation.yo: Bí ó bá tún tẹ̀ wọ́n ní ẹ̀rìn kejì, sààárè ń sún mọ́ nìyẹn.
translation.en: When they are being infected the second time, it is becoming deadlier.

translation.yo: Ìròyìn nípa àjàkálẹ̀ àìsàn yìí ń gba gbogbo orí ẹrọ-alátagbà kan tí ó sì ń mú àìbalẹ̀ara àti ọkàn bá ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn òǹlo ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà.
translation.en: Reports about new infection cases are spreading on social media and many users are becoming increasingly worried.

translation.yo: Shofiq Ahmed pín Túwíìtì kan nípa ìròyìn àìsàn tuntun:
translation.en: Shofiq Ahmed shared a Tweet about a newly reported case:

translation.yo: Àwọn dókítà méjì kan náà kú látàrí ibà-ẹ̀fọn, èyí sì ti ń mú kí àwọn ènìyàn ó máa bẹ̀rù.
translation.en: Even two doctors died in Dengue fever, and people are afraid now.

translation.yo: Ilé-ẹjọ́ Gíga Dhaka ti fi àṣẹ pe Ọ̀gá Àgbà Ètò Ìlera ti ìjọba.
translation.en: The Dhaka Highcourt has summoned the Chief Health Officers of the government.

translation.yo: Àwọn tí ó ń kú nh pọ̀ ọ́ sí i.
translation.en: The death toll is incereasing.

translation.yo: Ǹjẹ́ ìjọbá ń ṣe tó?
translation.en: Is the government doing enough?

translation.yo: Ojú-ìwé Facebook ti BBC Bangla rọ àwọn òǹkàwée rẹ̀ láti jábọ̀ àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ akin tí àwọn òníṣẹ́ ìlú Dhaka ń gbé láti gbógun ti ẹ̀fọn.
translation.en: BBC Bangla Facebook page asked its readers to report back about any efforts by city officials in Dhaka to combat the spread the mosquitos.

translation.yo: Òǹlò Mohammad Mynuddin jábọ̀ ìfàsẹ́yìn láti ọwọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba láti kápá àjàkálẹ̀ náà:
translation.en: User Mohammad Mynuddin reported astonishing delays on the part of government officials to address the outbreak:

translation.yo: A ò tíì rí nǹkan.
translation.en: Nothing has been seen.

translation.yo: Òṣìṣẹ́ Àjọ Ìlú kan ti sọ wípé yóò tó ọ̀sẹ̀ mélòó kan kí egbògi ìdáààbòbò tí yó sì dín ẹ̀fọn kù.
translation.en: A (City Corporation) worker has said that it would take a few weeks to import the protective drugs to decrease mosquitoes.

translation.yo: Ó yà mí lẹ́nu 🤔🤔
translation.en: I was astonished 🤔🤔

translation.yo: Àwọn kan lérò wípé ìjọba ò mú kiní ibà-ẹ̀fọn ọ̀hún ní kanpá, àwọn ọmọìlú ń lo ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà mú kí àwọn ènìyàn ó mọ̀ nípa kòkòrò náà.
translation.en: With what many see as a lack of government response to the spike in dengue cases, citizens are taking to social media to raise awareness about the virus.

translation.yo: Health Barta gbé fídíò kan sí oríi YouTube tí ó ń ṣe àlàyé lẹ́kùnúnrẹ́rẹ́ ohun tí ó pọn dandan láti ṣe bí èèyán bá ní ibà-ẹ̀fọn:
translation.en: Citizen media news outlet Health Barta uploaded a YouTube video detailing what to do when someone has dengue fever:

translation.yo: Ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ l’ó ń d'orí kọ ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà lọ láti gba ẹ̀jẹ̀ fún àwọn aláìsàn.
translation.en: Many are resorting to social media to collect blood for patients.

translation.yo: Òǹlo Sajid Islam Khan túwíìtì pé òún nílò ẹ̀jẹ̀ fún àbúrò òun tí ibà-ẹ̀fọn ń bá fínra.
translation.en: User Sajid Islam Khan tweeted that he needs blood for his brother who is suffering from dengue.

translation.yo: Hannan Gazi náà se àgbéjáde tirẹ̀:
translation.en: Hannan Gazi posted a similar message:

translation.yo: Àmì ibà-ẹ̀fọn àti àtiṣe..
translation.en: The symptoms of dengue fevere and what to do..

translation.yo: Ní àárín-in àjàkálẹ̀ náà, Alákòóso-ìlú Àríwá Dhaka ti fagilé ìsinmi ránpẹ́ àwọn ikọ̀ tí ó ń rí sí pàntí kíkó àti ìgbégidínà àpọ̀si ẹ̀fọn.
translation.en: Amidst the outbreak, the Mayor of Dhaka City North has canceled holiday leave for waste disposal and mosquito deterrent teams.

translation.yo: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, fún ìdáààbò àwọn ènìyàn, ṣíṣe ṣì kú.
translation.en: However, to protect people from dengue fever, a lot more effort may be needed.

translation.yo: Àdàwólulẹ̀ ilé ayé-àtijọ́ ọlọ́dún-un 150 fi àìkáràmáìsìkí ìjọba sí àwọn ibi àjogúnbáa Bangladesh hàn
translation.en: Demolition of a 150-year-old building highlights government neglect of Bangladesh's heritage sites

translation.yo: Ilé àjogúnbá náà di àwópalẹ̀ pẹ̀lú bí Ilé-ẹjọ́ Gíga ṣe pa àṣẹ.
translation.en: The landmark building was demolished despite a High Court Directive

translation.yo: Ẹgẹrẹmìtì “Jahaj Bari” kí ó tó di àdàwólulẹ̀.
translation.en: The dilapidated state of “Jahaj Bari” before being demolished.

translation.yo: Òun ni ilé àkọ́kọ́ àyàgbé ní olú-ìlú Bangladeshi, Dhaka, a kọ́ ọ ní ọdún-un 1870. Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Shakil Ahmed, a fi àṣẹ lò ó.
translation.en: It was the first commercial house in the Bangladeshi capital, Dhaka, built in 1870. Image by Shakil Ahmed, used with permission.

translation.yo: Ní Dhaka, ilé àjogúnbá ọlọ́gọ́rùn-ún ọdún kan di àdàwólulẹ̀ pátá ní alẹ́ ọjọ́ Ìtunu Àwẹ̀ 5, oṣù Òkúdù 2019.
translation.en: In Dhaka, a century-old heritage building was demolished clandestinely on the night of Eid-ul-Fitr on June 5, 2019.

translation.yo: Ní nǹkan bíi ọdún-un 1870 ni a kọ́ ilé náà tí ó fẹ́ẹ́ dà bíi ọkọ̀ ojú-omi, tí àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ ń pè ní "Jahaj Bari", òun sì ni ilé àyágbé àkọ́kọ́ ni olú-ìlúu Bangladesh.
translation.en: The ship-like structure, known locally as "Jahaj Bari", was built around 1870 and considered to be the first commercial building in Bangladesh's capital.

translation.yo: Àdàwólulẹ̀ tí a da ilé yìí ti mú kí àwọn ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ó sọ ẹ̀dùn ọkàn-an wọn síta lórí àìbìkítà fún àwọn ilé tí ó jẹ́ ohun ìṣúra Dhaka.
translation.en: Its demolition has caused many to speak out against the neglect of Dhaka's architectural treasures.

translation.yo: Ìròyìn fi yé wípé àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú tí ó wà lórí ipò ìyẹn Awami League (AL) gbé ẹ̀rọ tatapùpù wá sí ibẹ̀, wọ́n sì da ilé náà wó.
translation.en: Media reports alleged that supporters of the ruling Awami League (AL) party brought three bulldozers to the location and demolished the building.

translation.yo: Àwọn tí ó wá ṣiṣẹ́ náà sọ wípé olóríi àwọn, ọmọ ìgbìmọ̀ ìbílẹ̀ (Dhaka-7) Haji Md. Salim, ti ra ilẹ̀ náà láti fi kọ́ ilé alájà tó pọ̀ sí ibùdó náà.
translation.en: The supporters claim that their leader, local member of parliament (Dhaka-7) Haji Md. Salim, bought the property to build a multi-story building on the site.

translation.yo: Bákan náà àwọn alátìlẹ́yìn AL sọ wípé ilé àtijọ́ náà kò sí lóríi àwọn ibi àjogúnbá tí ó wà nínú àkọsílẹ̀.
translation.en: The AL supporters also claimed that the building was not included on any heritage list.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 13, oṣù Ògún ọdún-un 2018, Ilé-ẹjọ́ Gíga Dhaka pàṣẹ fún àjọ ìjọba tí ó ń rí sí ètò ìdàgbàsókè ìlú ní ìlànà tìgbàlódé ní Dhaka láti máà wó tàbí tún àwọn ilé àjogúnbá tí ó wà ní olú-ìlú náà tó bíi 2,200 kọ́.
translation.en: On August 13, 2018, the Dhaka High Court issued a directive to the government agency responsible for coordinating urban development in Dhaka to not approve or allow the demolition or modification of 2,200 archaeologically significant buildings around the capital city.

translation.yo: Jahaj Bari wà nínú àwọn ilé àkọ́pọ̀ Waqf (mortmain) tí kò ṣe é tà.
translation.en: Jahaj Bari is also part of a Waqf (mortmain) estate that, as part of a charitable donation, could not be sold.

translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí alákòóso Bangladesh Waqf Administratioń ṣe sọ, gbígba àṣẹ pọn dandan láti gbé iṣẹ́ sílẹ̀, tà tàbí ṣe àtúnṣe sí ohunkóhun tí ó bá jẹ́ ti Waqf.
translation.en: According to the administrator of Bangladesh's Waqf Administration, it is mandatory to have permission in order to hand over, sell or develop any Waqf property.

translation.yo: Èyí kò rí bí ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ AL náà ti ṣe wí, kò sí ohun tó jọ ọ́, kò sí àṣẹ tí ó ní kí wọ́n tà tàbí wó ilé tí à ń sọ̀rọ̀ọ rẹ̀ yìí.
translation.en: Contrary to the claims of the AL activists, no such permission was requested for the sale or demolition of the building in question.

translation.yo: Nínú oṣùu Ẹrẹ́nà ọdún-un 2019, a gbé ìgbésẹ̀ kan láti da ilé náà wó lulẹ̀.
translation.en: In March 2019, an attempt was made to demolish the building.

translation.yo: Urban Study Group, ẹgbẹ́ aṣiṣẹ́ ọ̀fẹ́-tí-kò-ní-èrè tí ó máa ń fi ààbò fún àwọn ohun àjogúnbá Dhaka Àtijọ́ fi ìwé ẹ̀dùn ìdáwọ́dúróo àdàwólulẹ̀ náà ránṣẹ́ sí àwọn tí ọ̀rán kàn, tí ó sì mẹ́nu ba àṣẹ Ilé-ẹjọ́ Gíga.
translation.en: Urban Study Group, a volunteer-run nonprofit group dedicated to protecting the historical urban fabric of Old Dhaka, filed a complaint to stop the demolition, citing the above mentioned High Court order.

translation.yo: Síbẹ̀, bí ìwé ìròyìn ṣe jábọ̀, díẹ̀ lára àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ ń yọ̀ fún àdàwólulẹ̀ ilé náà.
translation.en: However, according to newspaper reports, some locals are happy that the building was demolished.

translation.yo: Wọ́n ò mọ̀ pé ilé náà ti di ẹgẹrẹmìtì, ó sì lè wò lulẹ̀ kí ó wó lù wọ́n—tí í ṣe àpẹẹrẹ àìmọ̀kanmọ̀kàn àwọn ènìyàn sí ìpamọ́ ohun àjogúnbá àti àtìlẹ́yìn fún àtúnṣe sí ilé àtijọ́ tí ó wà ní Bangladesh.
translation.en: They felt that it was in a dilapidated state and feared that it would fall down on them—an indication of the lack of awareness of historical preservation and support for the restoration of heritage buildings in Bangladesh.

translation.yo: Àjogúnbá Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ Àtẹ̀yìnwá —ọ̀rọ̀ tí ò jẹ́ mọ́ nǹkan
translation.en: Heritage history—just empty words

translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn l'ó fi ẹ̀dùn ọkàn-an wọn hàn nígbà tí wọ́n gbọ́ nípa àmúdipẹ̀tẹ́lẹ̀ ilé náà.
translation.en: Many expressed their anger on hearing about the destruction of the building.

translation.yo: Shuvra Kar kọ sí oríi Facebook:
translation.en: Shuvra Kar wrote on Facebook:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Àjogúnbá , ìtàn-ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-àtẹ̀yìnwá, àṣá jẹ́ ọ̀rọ̀ tí kò já mọ́ nǹkan ní orílẹ̀-èdè yìí!
translation.en: Heritage, history, culture these are just empty words in this country!

translation.yo: Òǹkọ̀wé Tania Kamrun Nahar tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ sí ìdí tí kò fi yẹ kí ilé yìí di àdàwólulẹ̀:
translation.en: Writer Tania Kamrun Nahar explained why this heritage building needed to be saved:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Ilé alájà-mẹ́ta náà “Jahaj Bari” ní àwọn iṣẹ́ ọnà tí ó yàrà ọ̀tọ̀ lára ní ara irin àgbọ́wọ́lé gun àkàsọ̀ .
translation.en: The three-storied "Jahaj Bari" had beautiful motifs on the railings.

translation.yo: Iṣẹ́ ọnà aláràbarà ti orí òrùlé ibi ìbojúwòta gígùn.
translation.en: The long verandah had designed roofs.

translation.yo: Ọ̀kanòjọ̀kan ọnà ni ó wà ní ara ilé náà — àwọn àràbarà ọnà abẹ́ àjà àti bẹ́ẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
translation.en: The whole building had many beautiful designs — pointed arches, decorated cornices.

translation.yo: Àwọn òpó ní àwòṣe ọnà ilée ionic àti Corinthian.
translation.en: The columns had ionic and Corinthian capital designs.

translation.yo: Ọnà ara ilé náà kọjá àfẹnusọ tí a kò le è rí lára àwọn ilé mìíràn ní àwọn agbègbè àtijọ́ọ Dhaka.
translation.en: The building had such remarkable designs which were rare to find in other buildings in the old parts of Dhaka.

translation.yo: Fún ìdí èyí, kò yẹ kí ilé náà di àdàwólulẹ̀.
translation.en: So, the building needed to be saved.

translation.yo: Ọdún-un 1610 ni Dhaka di olú-ìlúu Bengal, ìyẹn ogójì ọdún sẹ́yìn.
translation.en: Dhaka was established as the capital of Bengal in 1610, more than four centuries ago.

translation.yo: Ní sáàa Mughal àti ìjọba amúnisìn British, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ilé tí a kọ́ ni ó ní ìtàn-ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-àtẹ̀yìnwá àti àjogúnbá ìlú náà kan tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ ọn.
translation.en: During the years of Mughal rule and British colonial rule, many buildings were built that form part of the history and heritage of the city.

translation.yo: Àmọ́ púpọ̀ nínú àwọn ilé wọ̀nyí ni ó ti wó láti ọjọ́ pípẹ́.
translation.en: But most of these buildings are long gone.

translation.yo: Àwọn tí ó ṣì ń dúró ti di ẹgẹrẹmìtì, èyí á mú kí àwọn kan ó máa lọ (ṣe ayédèrú ìwé láti) gbẹ́sẹ̀ lé ilé wọ̀nyí.
translation.en: The ones that remain are in a dilapidated state and are destined to be grabbed by occupants claiming ownership of the buildings (often by forging documents).

translation.yo: Àpẹẹrẹ kan ni Bara Katra, àrágbáramúramù ilé tí ó ní ìtàn-ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-àtẹ̀yìnwá tí Mir Abul Qasim, Diwan (alága ètò ìṣúná) ti ó jẹ́ ọmọba Shah Shuja Mughul kọ́ ní nǹkan bíi 1644 àti 1646.
translation.en: One example is Bara Katra, a historical and architectural monument built between 1644 and 1646 AD by Mir Abul Qasim, the Diwan (chief revenue official) of the Mughal prince Shah Shuja.

translation.yo: Ó jẹ́ nǹkan ìbànújẹ́ wípé ilé náà ti ṣe tán, ó lè wó nígbàkigbà látorí àìṣàtúnṣe, àìkáràmáìsìkí ohun àjogúnbá, àti ìbàjẹ́ tí àwọn tí ó gbé ilé láì gba àṣẹ ń fà.
translation.en: The building is on the verge of collapsee due to the lack of maintenance, preservation efforts, and damage caused by illegal occupants.

translation.yo: Bara Katra, àwòṣe ilé kíkọ́ ìbílẹ̀ Àárín gbùngbùn Asian caravanserais ni a fi kọ́ ọ, ó sì ní ọwọ́ọ àwòṣe Mughal náà.
translation.en: Bara Katra, the structure was built according to the traditional pattern of Central Asian caravanserais and is embellished in the style of Mughal architecture.

translation.yo: Ragib Hassan ni ó ní àwòrán ní oríi Wikipedia. CC BY 2.5
translation.en: Image by Ragib Hassan via Wikipedia. CC BY 2.5

translation.yo: Muntasir Mamun ti kọ àìmọye ìwé lóríi ìtàn-ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-àtẹ̀yìnwá àti àjogúnbá ìlúu Dhaka.
translation.en: Muntasir Mamun has written many books on the history and heritage of Dhaka city.

translation.yo: Ó kọ sínú ìwé ìròyìn ìbílẹ̀ẹ Bhorer Kagoj:
translation.en: He wrote in a local newspaper Bhorer Kagoj:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Mo ti rawọ́ ẹ̀bẹ̀ sí àwọn aláṣẹ fún ogójì ọdún tí ó kọjá láti gba àwọn ilé àjogúnbá bíi Bara Katra àti Choto Katra sílẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ àwọn tí ó fẹ́ pa ìtàn àtẹ̀yìnwá rẹ́.
translation.en: I have pleaded to the authorities in the past four decades to save the heritage buildings like Bara Katra and Choto Katra.

translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n kò sí ẹni tí ó dá mi lóhùn.
translation.en: But nobody listened.

translation.yo: Kí ni ká sọ? Nígbà tí ẹ̀ka tí ó ń ṣe àkópamọ́ sítám̀pù ti wo ògiri àtijọ́ àmọ̀káyée Lalbagh Fort láti fi ṣe àyè ìgbọ́kọ̀sí.
translation.en: When the philatelic department demolished part of the old walls of the famous Lalbagh Fort to make a car park, what can you say?

translation.yo: Báwo ni a ó ṣe dojú ìjà kọ ìwà òmùgọ̀?
translation.en: How can you fight against stupidity?

translation.yo: Ilé oníròyìn orí-ayélujára kan ti ṣe àtẹ̀jáde àbájáde ìwádìí tí ó jinlẹ̀ nípa àìkáràmáìsìkí ìjọba lóríi àwọn ilé àjogúnbá àti àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ tí ó ń gbìyànjú láti da àwọn ilé tí ó kù wó:
translation.en: An online news portal has published an in-depth report about government negligence of these heritage buildings and the influential people trying to demolish existing buildings:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Ilé tí ó wà ní ipò.14 ní orí ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ àjogúnbá ti di wíwó.
translation.en: The no. 14 house in the heritage list has already been taken down.

translation.yo: Apá kan lára àwọn ilé àwòṣífìlà tí ó wà ní Sutrapur kò ṣe é rí mọ́n.
translation.en: Most parts of the famous big house in Sutrapur has been destroyed.

translation.yo: Iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe sí àwọn àjogúnbá ìgbàa Mughal ní mọ́ṣálááṣí Bangshal Mukim Bazar Jam-e àti mọ́ṣálááṣí Siddique Bazar Jam-e ti di ohun ìgbàgbé nítorí ojú àpá ò le è jọ ojú ara, ó ti yàtọ̀.
translation.en: The relics of the Mughal era in Bangshal Mukim Bazar Jam-e Mosque and Siddique Bazar Jam-e Mosque are gone with a new structure in place in the name of renovation.

translation.yo: Àmọ́ ṣá, ó ní àṣẹ ìjọba tí ó fi ààbò bo àwọn ilé àjogúnbá, àwọn agbèfúnjọba ti agbègbèe Rajdhani Unnayan Kartripakkha àti Àjọ Ìlúu Dhaka kò ṣe ohun tí ó yẹ kí wọn ó ṣe.
translation.en: Although there is a government directive to protect heritage buildings, the officials of Rajdhani Unnayan Kartripakkha and Dhaka City Corporation are not doing anything.

translation.yo: Àìṣojúṣe wọn ni ó fà á tí àwọn olóṣèlú olójúkòkòrò ṣe ń gba àwọn ilé àtijọ́ tí wọ́n sì ń dà wọ́n wó lulẹ̀.
translation.en: Their inaction is encouraging greedy parties to grab the old properties and destroy them.

translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ Urban Study ti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ìwọ́de àti àkójọ àwọn ènìyàn tí yóò fi ẹ̀hónú àdàwólulẹ̀ wọ̀nyí hàn.
translation.en: The Urban Study Group has organized rallies and human chains to protest these demolitions.

translation.yo: Bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni wọ́n gbèrò láti ṣe ìkéde nípa ìdààbò bo àwọn ilé àjogúnbá tí ọ̀rán kàn.
translation.en: They are also keen to create awareness to protect other endangered heritage buildings.

translation.en: Nimtali Palace, it was the residence of the Deputy Governor of Dhaka during the Mughal rule.

translation.yo: Ìloro àbáwọlé ìwọ̀-oòrùn-un ààfin náà nìkan ló ṣì ń dúró.
translation.en: Only the west gate of the palace still survives.

translation.yo: Láìsí àmójútó, ilé yìí ṣì dúró.
translation.en: Without preservation, this building is barely surviving.
