translation.yo: China fi ọwọ́ọ ṣìnkún òfin mú ayàwòrán eré orí ìtàgé nítorí pé ó tún àwòrán ìgò ọtí-líle kan tí ó ń tọ́ka sí Ìpanìyànnípakúpa Tiananmen pín
translation.en: China arrests filmmaker for retweeting an image of a liquor bottle referencing Tiananmen Massacre

translation.yo: Àwọn ìgòo Baijiu ń ṣe ìrántí ìpànìyànnípakúpa Tiananmen náà.
translation.en: Baijiu bottles commemorating the Tiananmen massacre.

translation.yo: Jennifer Creery ni ẹni tí ó kọ ìròyìn yìí, tí Ilé Iṣẹ́ Atẹ̀wé Olómìnira Hong Kong sì tẹ̀ ẹ́ jáde ní ọjọ́ 24 oṣù Èbìbí ọdún-un 2019.
translation.en: The following post is originally written by Jennifer Creery and published by Hong Kong Free Press on May 24, 2019.

translation.yo: Ohùn Àgbáyé ṣe ẹ̀dàa ìròyìn náà ní abẹ́ ìtọwọ́bọ̀wé àjọṣe pọ̀ ìkóròyìnjọ.
translation.en: The following edited version is republished on Global Voices under a content partnership agreement.

translation.yo: Àwọn aláṣẹ ìjọba China ti fi ayàwòrán eré aṣakọ̀sílẹ̀-ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ Deng Chuanbin sí àtìmọ́lé lẹ́yìn tí ó ṣe túwíìtì àwòrán ìgò ọtí-líle kan tí a sààmìi "64" sí lára – tí ó ń tọ́ka sí ọjọ́ burúkú Èṣù gbomi mu Ìpaninípakúpa tí ó wáyé ní Tiananmen Square ní ọjọ́ 4, oṣù Òkúdù ọdún-un 1989.
translation.en: Chinese authorities have reportedly detained documentary filmmaker Deng Chuanbin after he tweeted an image of a liquor bottle labelled "64" – a reference to the date of the Tiananmen Square Massacre which occurred on June 4, 1989.

translation.yo: Ìgò ọtí-líle 64
translation.en: 64 liquor bottle

translation.yo: Ọdún-un 2016 ni a ṣe ìgòo ọtí-líle náà, ìyẹn ní ìrántí ọdún kẹtàdínlọ́gbọ̀n tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ láabi ọjọ́ 4 oṣù Òkúdù wáyé.
translation.en: The liquor bottle was designed in 2016 to commemorate the 27th anniversary of June 4.

translation.yo: Orúkọ tí a pe ọtí-líle náà ni "8 wine 64".
translation.en: The liquor was called "8 wine 64".

translation.yo: Bí a ti ṣe ń pe "wine" ní èdèe Putonghua náà ni à ń pe "9".
translation.en: The pronunciation of the word "wine" in Putonghua is the same with the word "9".

translation.yo: Ààmì ara ìgò náà ní àwòrán "Ọkùnrin ọkọ̀-ogun" tí a kọ "Máà ṣe gbàgbé, máà ṣe sọ̀rètí nù".
translation.en: The bottle label carries the image of "Tank Man" with the description "Never forget, never give up".

translation.yo: Ó sì tún fi han gbangbagbàngbà pé Beijing ni a ti ṣe ọtíi wáìnì náà tí ó ní ìdá 64 iye ọtí-líle nínú tí ó sì ti wà nílé ìtajà fún ọdún mẹ́tadínlọ́gbọ̀n.
translation.en: It also specifies that the wine comes from Beijing, with 64% alcohol and has been stored for 27 years.

translation.yo: A fi ọwọ́ọ ṣìnkún òfin mú àwọn ọmọkùnrin orílẹ̀ èdèe China mẹ́rin, Fu Hailu, Zhang Jinyong, Luo Fuyu àti Chen Bing, ní ọdún-un 2016 fún ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìgò ọtí-líle tí a sì fi ẹ̀sùn-un “rírú ìṣẹ́po agbáraiìlú sókè”.
translation.en: Four Chinese men, Fu Hailu, Zhang Jinyong, Luo Fuyu and Chen Bing, were arrested in 2016 for the liquor bottle incident charged with "inciting subversion of state power".

translation.yo: Ìgbẹ́jọ́ Fu, Zhang àti Luo's wáyé ní ibìkan ní Ilé-ẹjọ́ Àwọn Ènìyàn Agbedeméjì Chengdu nínú oṣù Igbe.
translation.en: Fu, Zhang and Luo's trial took place at the Chengdu Intermediate People’s Court in April.

translation.yo: Ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan wọn gba ìdájọ́ ìgbà ọdún mẹ́ta ní ẹ̀wọ̀n pẹ̀lú ìdádúró ọdún mẹ́rin sí márùn-ún.
translation.en: They were respectively handed a three-year prison term with four to five years in suspension.

translation.yo: Nítorí pé Chen kò gbà wípé òun dá ẹ̀ṣẹ̀, ó sì wà lábẹ́ẹ ṣìgún òfin.
translation.en: Chen is still under arrest as he refused to plead guilty.

translation.yo: Pẹ̀lú ìdádúró ìránlẹ́wọ̀n, àwọn mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta ṣì wà lábẹ́ ìṣọ́:
translation.en: Despite the suspended sentence, the three are still under surveillance:

translation.yo: Ìfọwọ́ọ ṣìnkún òfin múni nítorí àtúnpín túwíìtì
translation.en: Arrest for a retweet

translation.yo: Ní ìpalẹ̀mọ́ ìsààmì ọgbọ̀n ọdún tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọjọ́ 4, ayàwòrán eré orí ìtàgé Deng Chuabin ti di ẹni tí ọ̀rọ̀ ìgò ọtí-líle 64 ń dá sẹ̀ríà fún lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́.
translation.en: Ahead of the 30th anniversary of June 4, filmmaker Deng Chuabin has become the latest victim related to the 64 liquor bottle.

translation.yo: Ọlọ́pàá Sichuan fi ọwọ́ọ ṣìgún òfin mú Deng ní ilée rẹ̀ ní Yibin ní ọjọ́ Ẹtì tí ó kọjá, lẹ́yìn wákàtí díẹ̀ tí ó ṣe àtúnpín àwòrán-an Twitter kan tí ó jẹ́ ti ìgò ọtí-líle 64, gẹ́gẹ́ bí Iléeṣẹ́-tí-kìí-ṣe-tìjọba, Adáààbòbo Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọ ènìyàn ti China (CHRD).
translation.en: Sichuan police arrested Deng at his home in Yibin last Friday, hours after he retweeted a Twitter photo of 64 liquor bottle, according to the NGO coalition, Chinese Human Rights Defenders (CHRD).

translation.yo: Ayàwòrán náà gba ìpè àwọn ọlọ́pàá lẹ́yìn-in ọgbọ̀n ìṣẹ́jú lẹ́yìn tí ó túwíìtì àwòrán náà pẹ̀lú wípé lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ ni ó mú un wálẹ̀, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni CHRD ṣe ti sọ.
translation.en: The filmmaker received a phone call from police 30 minutes after tweeting the image despite quickly deleting the post, said CHRD.

translation.yo: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá fi agbára gba ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ alágbèéká mẹ́ta, ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá kọ̀mpútà kan, ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá àgbélétan kan, iPad, ike pélébé ìrántí àti ẹ̀rọ ayàwòrán kékeré kan nígbà tí wọ́n wá sí ilée rẹ̀.
translation.en: Police seized three mobile phones, a computer, laptop, iPad, memory cards and compact camera while at his home.

translation.yo: Deng ti wà ní Àtìmọ́lé Agbègbè Nanxi nítorí wípé “ó ń bá ìjà bọ̀” – ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n sábà máa ń kà mọ́ àwọn ènìyàn tí ó ń takò ìjọba lẹ́sẹ̀.
translation.en: Deng is reportedly being held in Nanxi District Detention Centre for "picking quarrels" – a charge frequently leveled against critics of the government.

translation.yo: CHRD sọ wípé fún wákàtí kan gbáko, àwọn ọlọ́pàá padà láti yẹ ilée Deng wò, wọ́n sì kó àwọn ẹ̀rọ lóríṣiríṣi:
translation.en: CHRD said police returned to raid Deng’s home for an hour, taking a range of electronic equipment:

translation.yo: 18 people are talking about this
translation.en: 18 people are talking about this

translation.yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí ó ń lọ nípa #Deng Chuabin: Ní ọjọ́ 20 oṣù Èbìbì ọdún-un 2019: Àwọn ọlọ́pàá àgọ́ọ Peizhi ránṣẹ́ sí bàbáa Deng.
translation.en: Update on #Deng Chuabin: On May 20, 2019: Deng's father was summoned to the police station at Peizhi town.

translation.yo: Àwọn kan tẹ̀lée padà sílé, wọ́n sì ya àwòrán nínú ilée wọn.
translation.en: A few men followed him back home and took video and photos in their house.

translation.yo: Wọ́n tú yàráa Deng Chuabin wò fún bíi wákàtí kan, wọ́n sì gbé ẹ̀rọ 20 àti agbaná sí ara ẹ̀rọ.
translation.en: They search Deng Chuabin's room for more than an hour and took away 20 electronic items including battery chargers.

translation.yo: Wọ́n tún ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, wọ́n mú okùn ìkòkò ìse-ìrẹsì.
translation.en: They even took away the electronic wire of their rice cooker.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 21, àwọn ọlọ́pàá sọ fún àwọn òbíi Deng láti máà gba agbẹjọ́rò fún un.
translation.en: On 21, the police station told Deng's parent not to employ lawyer for Deng.

translation.yo: Deng, tí a tún mọ̀ sí Huang Huang, tí ó jẹ́ ayàwòrán aládàádúró tí ó ti bá òǹyàwòrán Beijing, Ai Weiwei ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀.
translation.en: Deng, also known as Huang Huang, is an independent filmmaker who has collaborated with Beijing artist Ai Weiwei.

translation.yo: Ó sọ wípé òun ti ní ìdojúkọ ìjọba, pẹ̀lú àtìmọ́lé ní ọdún-un 2015 láti dénà dè é kí ó máà lọ sí ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn ní Geneva.
translation.en: He claims to have previously faced intimidation by authorities, including detention in 2015 to prevent him from attending a human rights seminar in Geneva.

translation.yo: Oṣù tí ó ń bọ̀ ni ó sààmì ọgbọ̀n ọdún tí ìpaninípakúpa Tiananmen Square wáyé.
translation.en: Next month marks 30 years since the Tiananmen Square Massacre.

translation.yo: Lọ́dọọdún, àwọn aláṣẹ China fi ọwọ́ agbára mú ìrántí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà, tí wọ́n sì fi àwọn agbọ̀rọ̀dùn sí àtìmọ́lé.
translation.en: Each year, Chinese authorities clamp down on references to the crackdown in the lead up to the anniversary, by placing outspoken dissidents on house arrest or in detention.

translation.yo: Ojúṣe láti ṣe ìrántí: ọgbọ̀n ọdún lẹ́yìn Tiananmen
translation.en: A duty to remember: 30 years after Tiananmen

translation.yo: Òǹyàwòrán ọmọ bíbí Taiwan Shake ni aṣàgbékalẹ̀, àwòrán Ọkùnrin Ọkọ̀ Ogun tí ó wà ní àárín gbùngùn-un Taipei ni ìmísí àgbékalẹ̀ náà.
translation.en: Installation made by Taiwanese artist Shake, and inspired by the photo of Tank Man displayed in central Taipei.

translation.yo: Filip Noubel ni ó ya àwòrán èyí, a fi àṣẹ lò ó.
translation.en: Photo by Filip Noubel, used with permission.

translation.yo: Ó ti tó 30 ọdún sí ìgbà ìgbérí sókè àti ìṣubú Ẹgbẹ́ Olóṣèlú Ìjọba Àwa-ara-wa 89 (八九民运) ní China tí ó kóra jọ di Ìpaninípakúpa Gbàgede àìlókìkí Tiananmen Square ní ọjọ́ 4 oṣù Òkúdù, 1989.
translation.en: It has been 30 years since the rise and fall of the 89 Democracy Movement (八九民运) in China that culminated in the infamous Tiananmen Square Massacre on June 4, 1989.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ yẹn, ikọ̀ ogun orílẹ̀-èdè China ṣíná bolẹ̀ fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ó ń ṣe ìwọ́de ìfẹ̀hónúhàn àtúnṣe ètò ìjọba àwaarawa.
translation.en: On that day, the Chinese military carried out a brutal crackdown on student-led demonstrations calling for democratic reforms.

translation.yo: Àjọ Alágbèélébùú Pupa ní yóò tó ọmọ orílẹ̀ 2,700 tí wọ́n pa, àmọ́ àwọn mìíràn nípé ó jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.
translation.en: The Chinese Red Cross estimated that 2,700 civilians were killed, but other sources point to a much higher toll.

translation.yo: Àkọpamọ́ kan tí ó jẹ́ ti ìjọba US jábọ̀ ní ọdún-un 2014 wípé àyẹ̀wò tí ó wáyé nínú China sọ wípé yóò fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ọmọ orílẹ̀ 10,454 tí wọ́n pa.
translation.en: A confidential US government document unveiled in 2014 reported that a Chinese internal assessment estimated that at least 10,454 civilians were killed.

translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ Olóṣèlú The Communist Party ti China kò fi ìgbà kan sọ ọ́ ní gbangba rí wípé òún mọ̀ wípé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ wọ̀nyí ṣẹ̀ tàbí ṣe ìwádìí fínnífínní síwájú sí i.
translation.en: The Communist Party of China has never publicly acknowledged these events or accounted for its actions with an independent investigation.

translation.yo: Kò sí ìtọ́ka kankan sí Ẹgbẹ́ Olóṣèlú Ìjọba Àwa-ara-wa 89 nínú ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àtẹ̀yìnwá kankan, àwọn ọmọ ilé ìwé tí ó ga jù lọ ní China kò gbọ́ nípa ìpaninípakúpa náà, kò ta sí wọn létí rí.
translation.en: There are no references to the 89 Democracy Movement in any history textbooks and most university students in China have never heard about the massacre.

translation.yo: Ohùn Àgbáyé ti ń jábọ̀ ìròyìn lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí fún ọdún mẹ́wàá.
translation.en: Global Voices has been covering the issue for over a decade.

translation.yo: Ní ọdún yìí ni a sààmì ọgbọ̀n ọdún ohun tí ó fa sábàbí ìpaninípakúpa ọjọ́ 4 oṣù Òkúdù àti láti ṣe ojúṣe wa láti rán àwọn ènìyàn létí, pẹ̀lú gbogbo ọ̀nà àgàbàgebè tí Beijing ń gbà láti fi eérú bo òtítọ́ mọ́lẹ̀.
translation.en: This year we commemorate the 30th anniversary of what led to the June 4 massacre to fulfill our duty to keep the memory of those events alive, despite continuous efforts by Beijing to deny basic historical truth.

translation.yo: Ìpinnu Beijing kò ju láti pa ohun gbogbo tí ó bá tan mọ́n ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọjọ́ 4 oṣù Òkúdù rẹ̀ lórí ayélujára.
translation.en: Beijing’s determination to censor any mention or veiled reference to June 4 has resulted in a perpetual game of cat and mouse taking place online.

translation.yo: Ní oṣù Igbe, ìpolówó òkè òkun kan tí ó ní àwòrán Ọkùnrin Ọkọ̀ Ogun fọ́nká sí orí ẹ̀rọ alátagbà orílẹ̀ èdèe China kí a tó mú un wálẹ̀.
translation.en: In April, a foreign ad featuring images of the Tank Man circulated briefly on Chinese social media before being suppressed.

translation.yo: Òmíràn nínú àwọn ìròyìn-in wa ṣàlàyé bí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdèe China tí ó wà lórí ayélujára ṣe máa ń fi ìpalẹ́numọ́ ṣeré àti wá ọ̀nà àrà tí wọ́n máa ń gbà sọ nípa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà láì dárúkọ rẹ̀, bí wọ́n bá sì fi ọwọ́ọ ṣìgún òfin mú wọn, ìjìyà ojú ẹsẹ̀ tí ó kọjáa kékeré ni onítọ̀hún yóò jẹ ní agodo ọba.
translation.en: Another of our stories explains how Chinese netizens play with censorship and come up with creative ways to allude to the event without mentioning it by its name, yet when they get caught, the punishment is immediate and severe.

translation.yo: Èyí ni àyíká tí ó mú ìkóròyìnjọ nira àti di ohun tí kò ṣe é ṣe nítorí gbogbo ìròyìn ní láti gba Asẹ́ Ńlá ìpalẹ́numọ́ orílẹ̀ èdèe China kọjá.
translation.en: All of this in an environment where obtaining information that is not filtered by China’s Great Firewall of online censorship has become very dangerous and almost impossible.

translation.yo: Bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni ìfojúṣùnnùnkùn wo ọ̀rọ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ alátagbà ní ẹ̀yin odi orílẹ̀ èdèe China náà mú ewu tirẹ̀ lọ́wọ́, gẹ́gẹ́ bí o ti ṣe kà nínú ìròyìn yìí.
translation.en: Expressing critical views on social media platforms outside of China also poses a personal risk, as you can read in this story.

translation.yo: Àtìmọ́lé àti ifipámúni ni èrè ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ẹni tí ó bá sọ èròńgbà tirẹ̀ tí ó yàtọ̀ sí ti Ẹgbẹ́ olóṣèlú ìjọba, bí a ṣe ṣàpèjúwe níbí.
translation.en: And expressing alternative views not aligned with the Party’s line, even if embedded in Marxism, usually results in harassment and arrest, as we describe here.

translation.yo: Irú ìpalẹ́numọ́ onísànánjúpa Beijing báwọ̀nyí ti ń kárí ayé, títí kan Hong Kong.
translation.en: This draconian censorship is being exported worldwide by Beijing, including to Hong Kong.

translation.yo: Síbẹ̀ ojúṣe láti rántí kò dẹ́kun fífi ìmísí sí ọkàn àwọn ènìyàn àti àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè káàkiri àgbáyé.
translation.en: Yet the duty to remember continues to inspire people and netizens across the globe.

translation.yo: Àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà ṣe ojúu wọn fọ ohun tí ó ń gbé wọn lọ́kàn síta nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wọ́rọ̀, bí àwọn akọni òǹkọ̀ròyìn ní Hong Kong ṣe ń kọ ìròyìn nípa ọjọ́ 4 oṣù Òkúdù.
translation.en: Direct witnesses speak up in emotional interviews, while brave journalists in Hong Kong tell their own stories about June 4.

translation.yo: Níṣe ni Hong Kong kún fún àwòrán ìdánimọ̀ ẹgbẹ́ náà, òrìṣà abo ti Àwaarawa ní ìta gbangba.
translation.en: Hong Kong also hosts copies of the most emblematic symbol of the movement, the Goddess of Democracy in public space.

translation.yo: Ní Taiwan, àgbékalẹ̀ẹ ọnà alágbára kan tí a gbé sí àárín gbùngbùn Taipei ń ṣe ìrántí àwọn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọdún-un 1989.
translation.en: In Taiwan, a powerful art installation displayed in central Taipei pays tribute to the events of 1989.

translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ orí ayélujára Àgbáyé, títí kan àwọn tí ó ń lo Reddit, náà ń lo ẹ̀fẹ̀, ọnà àti àwòrán orí ayélujára tí a fi àyọkà sínúu rẹ̀ rán ni létí nípa ìjàgbara ọ̀rọ̀ ìjọba àwaarawa.
translation.en: Global netizens, including Reddit users, also use humor, art, and online memes to keep the memory of the Chinese pro-democracy movement alive.

translation.yo: ‘Ohùn-un Jamaica fún Àyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́’ fi orin jíṣẹ́ẹ wọn
translation.en: Jamaica’s ‘Voices for Climate Change’ spreads its message with music

translation.yo: Àwòrán láti fídíò oríi YouTube “Ohùn fún Àyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́ fún Ẹ̀kọ́ Àyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́ – Ìpolongo ọdún 2019,” tí Panos Caribbean tẹ̀ jáde.
translation.en: Screenshot from the YouTube video "Voices for Climate Change Education – 2019 Campaign", published by Panos Caribbean.

translation.yo: Iléeṣẹ́ náà ti ṣe ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ìpolongo ìkéde àyípadà ojú-ọjọ́ ní agbègbè mẹ́rin ní àárín-in Jamaica: Rocky Point àti Lionel Town ní ẹ̀ka ìlúu Clarendon, Ridge Red Bank ní St. Elizabeth àti White River ní St Ann.
translation.en: The organisation has launched an eight-month climate change community awareness campaign in four communities across Jamaica: Rocky Point and Lionel Town in the parish of Clarendon, Ridge Red Bank in St. Elizabeth and White River in St Ann.

translation.yo: Bí orin reggae àti dancehall ṣe ń lọ ni àwọn ìpolongo tí ó ń sọ nípa ohun gbogbo láti ọṣẹ ìfọṣọ àbùfọ̀ sí oúnjẹ àsèsílẹ̀, orin ni ènìyán lè gbà dé ọkàn ọmọ Jamaica — èyí ló mú Panos Caribbean, ẹni tí ó ní ilé iṣẹ́ ìròyìn tí kì í ṣe ti ìjọba, láti fi orin kéde nípa ọ̀rọ̀ àyíká.
translation.en: From reggae and dancehall music to jingles extolling the virtues of everything from laundry detergent to fast food, the way to any Jamaican’s heart is through song — prompting Panos Caribbean, a media-savvy non-governmental organisation, to take a musical approach to spread its environmental message.

translation.yo: Iléeṣẹ́ náà ti yege nínúu ìtànká àwọn ìkéde tí ó ṣe kókó nípasẹ̀ẹ iṣẹ́ Ohùn fún Àyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́.
translation.en: The organisation has been successfully sharing critical information with the public through its Voices for Climate Change project.

translation.yo: Kedere ni ohùn ń jáde láti inú ilé àpérò ìlú-mọ̀ńká United Nations Conference ní Paris (COP21) lọ́dún-un 2015.
translation.en: Those voices rang out loud and clear at the historic United Nations Conference in Paris (COP21) in 2015.

translation.yo: Níbẹ̀, ọ̀kọrin ọmọ Jamaica Aaron Silk darapọ̀ mọ́ àwọn olórin mìíràn — pẹ̀lú eléré Belizean Adrian Martinez — láti ṣe alágbàáwí ìdínkù fún ìgbóná àgbáyé sí ìwọ̀n-ọn ojúàmì 1.5.
translation.en: There, Jamaican singer and songwriter Aaron Silk joined forces with other musicians — including Belizean performer Adrian Martinez — to advocate for a 1.5-degree limit to global warming.

translation.yo: Ìfiránṣẹ́ olórin náà, tí ó ṣe àtìlẹ́yìn, ipòo ti ìdásílẹ̀ Ìpínlẹ̀ Erékùṣù Kéékèèké Tí-ó-ń-gòkè, jẹ́ ohun àfiyèsí, tí ó ń ní ipa nínúu ìwé-ìpamọ́ ìkẹyìn-in ti COP21.
translation.en: The musical message, which supported the position of Small Island Developing States, was considerable, influencing the aspirations reflected in COP21’s final document.

translation.yo: Ọdún gorí ọdún, iṣẹ́ “1.5 túbọ̀ ń rinlẹ̀ sí i ní ìlà-oòrùn Caribbean, níbi tí àwọn ọ̀kọrin ti ṣe àlọ́pọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ akéwì St. Lucian Kendel Hippolyte’s pẹ̀lú orin-in ti wọn láti ṣe àrídájú wípé iṣẹ́ náà dé ibi tí ó yẹ kí ó dé.
translation.en: Years later, the “1.5” message continues to resonate in the eastern Caribbean, where singers have intertwined St. Lucian poet Kendel Hippolyte’s words with their own lyrics in order to ensure the message hits home.

translation.yo: Olùyàwòrán agbègbè Sammy Junior, láti Rocky Point, Clarendon (agbègbè tí ìrúsókè-odò ọ̀sà àti àgbàrá ibi tí ó súnmọ́ omi ti kó bá) níbi ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí ó dá lóríi Ìfiṣẹ́ránṣẹ́ Àyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́ ní Jamaica ní ọjọ́ 14 oṣù Ẹrẹ́nà, ọdún-un 2019.
translation.en: Community artist Sammy Junior, from Rocky Point, Clarendon (a community impacted by sea level rise and coastal erosion) at a workshop on Climate Change Messaging in Jamaica on March 14, 2019.

translation.yo: Àwòrán-an Emma Lewis, pẹ̀lú àṣẹ ni a fi lò ó.
translation.en: Photo by Emma Lewis, used with permission.

translation.yo: Wàhálà àyípadà ojú-ọjọ́ ní ọdún-un 2019 jẹ́ ohun tí ó nílò àbójútó kíákíá ju ti ìdúnrin lọ, àti ní Jamaica, àwọn ará ìgbèríko tí ó jẹ́ àgbẹ̀, àwọn apẹja ń gbọ́ ìpè itanijí yìí.
translation.en: The climate change crisis in 2019 is even more urgent than it was four years ago and in Jamaica, rural citizens from farmers to fisherfolk are heeding the wake-up call.

translation.yo: Akọrin, ọmọ ilé ìwé àti àwọn aládùúgbò péjọ ní — Kingston, Lionel Town, Ridge Red Bank àti White River — fún ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́rin nínúu oṣù Ẹrẹ́nà àti Igbe.
translation.en: Artists, schoolchildren and community members came together in different parts of Jamaica — Kingston, Lionel Town, Ridge Red Bank and White River — for four days of workshops during the months of March and April.

translation.yo: Níbẹ̀, wọ́n fi ẹ̀kọ́ kún ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀ ìtàkùrọ̀sọ àti kọ́ nípa ipa àyípadà ojú-ọjọ́.
translation.en: There, they honed their communication skills and learned about the impact of climate change.

translation.yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ orin tí ó lágbára gbérí, ọgbọ́n ń tayọ àti ìrìnàjò ìṣíjú ojú ẹsẹ̀:
translation.en: Powerful lyrics emerged, ideas flowed and eye-opening field trips provided on-the-ground perspectives:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Ìyá Ilẹ̀-ayé ń ké tantan
translation.en: Mother Earth she bawls

translation.yo: Nínú igbó kìjikìji níbi tí àwọn igi ń wó sí
translation.en: Deep in the forest where the trees fall

translation.yo: Wo òkúta ìsàlẹ̀ òkun, wo ẹja bí ó ṣe kéré
translation.en: Look upon the reef, see the fish how small

translation.yo: Fún wọn ní àsìkò, jẹ́ kí wọ́n dàgbà àti ga
translation.en: Give them a little time, make them grow big and tall

translation.yo: Àwọn akọrin láti Kingston, Clarendon àti Spanish Town ń ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ lóríi ọ̀rọ̀ orin níbi ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Ìfiṣẹ́ránṣẹ́ Àyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́.
translation.en: Artists from Kingston, Clarendon and Spanish Town working together on lyrics at the Climate Change Messaging workshop.

translation.yo: Àwòrán-an Emma Lewis, a lò ó pẹ̀lú àṣẹ.
translation.en: Photo by Emma Lewis, used with permission.

translation.yo: Pẹ̀lú ìfilọ́lẹ̀ẹ Panos fún àkòrí orin tuntun fún Caribbean fún Àyájọ́ Ilẹ̀-ayé, ẹgbẹ́ẹ Jamaica náà ti ṣe tán láti ṣe eré ní iléèwé àti ní àdúgbò, láì yọ Kàwé Jákèjádò Jamaica sílẹ̀ àti iṣẹ́ igi gbíngbìn.
translation.en: With Panos’ launch of a new Caribbean theme song for Earth Day, the Jamaican group is booked solid for school and community concerts, as well as the Read Across Jamaica initiative and tree-planting sessions.

translation.yo: Àwọn orin báwọ̀nyí, tí a kọ sí orí ìlú reggae àtijọ́ tí a fi àlùjó kún, ṣe kẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ̀rẹ̀ mi ìgboro:
translation.en: Lyrics like these, delivered to a roots reggae rhythm and infused with dancehall vibes, somehow manage to hit home:

translation.yo: Ìyá Ìṣẹ̀dá ń kérora fún ìwàláàyè
translation.en: Mother Nature yearns for life

translation.yo: Bí àwọn iléeṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣiṣẹ́, ìyá ń ké.
translation.en: The more the factories burn, she cries.

translation.yo: Ìgbà wo ni a óò kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́, tí a ó fi gbọ́n?
translation.en: When will we learn, and be wise?

translation.yo: Bí omi-dídì ilé ayé ṣe ń yọ́, òkun ń kún.
translation.en: The more the ice caps melt, the sea rise.

translation.yo: Pẹ̀lú ìdásílẹ̀ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn-in Reuters, ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ní òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ ṣì jẹ́ ní Myanmar
translation.en: Despite the release of detained Reuters reporters, free speech remains under threat in Myanmar

translation.yo: Akọ̀ròyìn Reuters méjì Wa Lone àti Kyaw Soe Oo rìnrìn òmìnira lẹ́yìn tí a dá wọn sílẹ̀ ní ẹ̀wọ̀n Insein ní Yangon.
translation.en: Two Reuters journalists Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo walked free from Insein prison in Yangon.

translation.yo: Àwòrán àti ọ̀rọ̀ abẹ́-àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Myo Min Soe / Irrawaddy náà ń bá Ohùn Àgbáyé ṣiṣẹ́ ìròyìn.
translation.en: Photo and caption by Myo Min Soe / The Irrawaddy is a content partner of Global Voices.

translation.yo: Àwọn ẹgbẹ́ iléeṣẹ́ oníròyìn àti ajà-fún-ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn ń ṣe àjọyọ̀ọ ti ìdásílẹ̀ lẹ́wọ̀n-ọn akọ̀ròyìn Reuters Wa Lone àti Kyaw Soe Oo tí ó lò ju ọjọ́ 500 ní àtìmọ́lé fún ipa tí wọ́n kó nínú ìwádìí òfíntótó ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìpanípakúpa àwọn olùgbée Rohingya kan ní gúúsù Myanmar.
translation.en: Media groups and human rights advocates are celebrating the release of Reuters journalists Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo who spent more than 500 days in detention for their role in investigating the massacre of some Rohingya residents in northern Myanmar.

translation.yo: Àmọ́ pẹ̀lú ìdásílẹ̀ tí wọ́n dá wọn sílẹ̀, ipò yẹpẹrẹ ni òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ ní ìlú náà nítorí wípé ìtìmọ́lé àti ìfìyàjẹ àwọn akọrin, akọ̀ròyìn, àti ajìjàǹgbara ṣì wà síbẹ̀ sẹpẹ́.
translation.en: But despite their release, the state of free speech in the country is still undermined by the continued detention and persecution of some artists, journalists, and activists.

translation.yo: Ka àwọn ọ̀ràn ìsàlẹ̀ yìí síwájú:
translation.en: Consider the following cases:

translation.yo: Ìfẹ̀sùn Ìbanilórúkọjẹ́ kan Irrawaddy Náà
translation.en: Defamation case against The Irrawaddy

translation.yo: Ẹ̀ka ológun Agbègbè Yangon kọ ìwé ẹ̀sùn-un ìbanilórúkọjẹ́ sí olóòtú èdèe-Burmese U Ye Ni wípé ibùdó-ìtakùn-àgbáyé akọ̀ròyìn náà gbè lẹ́yìn ẹnìkan nínú ìròyìn ìkọlù láàárín-in ọmọ-ogun ìjọba àti àwọn adárúgúdù sílẹ̀ Ọmọ ogun Arakan ní Ìpínlẹ̀ Rakhine tí ó tẹ̀ jáde.
translation.en: A defamation complaint was filed by the military's Yangon Region Command against The Irrawaddy's Burmese-language editor U Ye Ni over the news website's alleged unfair coverage of the armed clashes between government forces and the insurgent Arakan Army in Rakhine State.

translation.yo: Irrawaddy Náà sọ wípé òun kò ṣe àṣemáṣe ju jíjábọ̀ọ ìwọ̀yáàjà tí ó bẹ́ sílẹ̀ ní sàkání náà láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún-un 2019.
translation.en: The Irrawaddy said it did nothing but report the escalating armed clashes in the region since the start of 2019.

translation.yo: Èsì tí U Ye Ni fún àwọn ọmọ ajagun rè é :
translation.en: Here is U Ye Ni’s response to the case filed by the military:

translation.yo: Ó ká mi lára nípé iṣẹ́ẹ wa kò yé ikọ̀ ajagun yékéyéké.
translation.en: I feel sorry about the military’s misunderstanding of us.

translation.yo: Nínú ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ìkọ̀ròyìn ni ó ti fi lélẹ̀ wípé a gbọdọ̀ tànmọ́lẹ̀ sí ìjìyà àwọn ènìyàn ní ibi tí rògbòdìyàn bá wà.
translation.en: Journalism dictates that we reveal the suffering of people in a conflict area.

translation.yo: Èròńgbà wa tí a fi tẹ̀lé ìròyìn náà ó ju láti fa àkíyèsí àwọn tí yóò tán ìṣòro sí ìjìyà àwọn ènìyàn.
translation.en: Our intention behind the coverage is to push those concerned to solve the problems by understanding the sufferings of the people.

translation.yo: Àjọṣepọ̀ tí ó dán mọ́nrán ń bẹ ní àárín-in Ohùn Àgbáyé àti Irrawaddy.
translation.en: The Irrawaddy is a content partner of Global Voices.

translation.yo: Àjùsẹ́wọ̀n fún yẹ̀yẹ́
translation.en: Jailed for satire

translation.yo: Ìyẹn bẹ́ẹ̀, àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ẹ ajótà Ìran Ọ̀kín Thangya márùn-ún di èrò ẹ̀wọ̀n tí ó wà ní Insein títí di ìgbà tí wọn yóò lọ sí ilé ẹjọ́ fún ẹ̀fẹ̀ tí wọ́n fi ológun ṣe. Eré ìtàgé tí ó ní àkójọpọ̀ orin abínibí, ijó àti ewì ni a mọ Thangyat mọ́.
translation.en: Meanwhile, five members of the Peacock Generation Thangyat troupe were sent to Insein prison to await trial for their satirical performance mocking the army. Thangyat is performance art similar to slam poetry featuring folk verses with traditional musical notes and is combined with song, dance, and chants.

translation.yo: Ẹ̀gbẹ́ alájòótà yìí ti tasẹ̀ àgẹ̀rẹ̀ sí òfin abala 505(a) tí ó ní wípé ọ̀daràn ni ẹni tí ó bá polongo ọ̀rọ̀, àyesọ, tàbí jábọ̀ irúu rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú èrò láti mú kí ikọ̀ ajagun ó máà ka ojúṣe rẹ̀ kún tàbí kùnà láti ṣe ojúṣee rẹ̀.
translation.en: The group was charged with violating article 505(a) of the penal code which criminalizes the circulation of statements, rumors, or reports with the intent to cause any military officer to disregard or fail in his duties.

translation.yo: Ọ̀kan lára ẹni tí a fi ẹ̀sùn kàn, Zeyar Lwin, sọ pé:
translation.en: Zeyar Lwin, one of the accused, said:

translation.yo: Gbogbo ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn wá jẹ́ ti òṣèlú torí ìdí èyí ó yẹ kí wọ́n ṣe àtúnṣe gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ọ̀rọ̀ òṣèlú.
translation.en: All of our cases are political issues so that they need to resolve them as political issues.

translation.yo: Bákan náà, mo máa sọ wípé gbogbo wa ní láti darapọ̀ mọ́ iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe sí ìwé òfin ọdún-un 2008 tí ó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ nínú ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba.
translation.en: And also, I’d like to say all of us need to join the work for amending the 2008 constitution being done in parliament.

translation.yo: Ní tèmi, gbogbo ọ̀ràn yìí pátá yóò jẹ́ yíyẹ̀ lulẹ̀ bí a bá le è ṣe iṣẹ́ àkọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀ ti àtúnṣe sí ìwé òfin.
translation.en: In my opinion all of these issues can be resolved if we can do the primary work of amending the constitution.

translation.yo: Zeyar Lwin ń tọ́ka sí ìwé òfin ọdún-un 2008 tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn atúnǹkanká gbàgbọ́ wípé a ṣe é to láti fi agbára fún ìṣèjọba ikọ̀ ajagun pàápàá lẹ́yìn tí alágbáda gba ìjọba.
translation.en: Zeyar Lwin is referring to the 2008 constitution which many analysts believe was designed to reinforce military rule even after the restoration of civilian leadership.

translation.yo: Aya-eré-ìtàgé aláàárẹ̀ nínú àtìmọ́lé
translation.en: Sickly filmmaker in detention

translation.yo: Ọ̀ràn aya-eré-ìtàgé Min Htin Ko Ko Gyi tún fi ìrísí ìhámọ́ tí a há àwọn akọrin pàtàkì mọ́.
translation.en: The case of filmmaker Min Htin Ko Ko Gyi also reflects the restrictions imposed on critical artists.

translation.yo: Ìwé ẹ̀sùn tí ọ̀físà jagunjagun kọ nípa àwọn àtẹ̀jáde ‘ìbanilórúkọjẹ́’ tí aya-eré-ìtàgé gbé sí orí Facebook tí ó fà á tí a fi fi òfin mú un.
translation.en: A complaint filed by a military officer against the filmmaker's ‘defamatory’ Facebook posts led to his arrest.

translation.yo: Min Htin Ko Ko Gyi ni olùdásílẹ̀ iléeṣẹ́ Àjọ̀dún Eré Ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ Iyì Ọmọnìyàn àti ìlúmọ̀nánká alátakò ìlọ́wọ́sí ikọ̀ ajagun nínú òṣèlú.
translation.en: Min Htin Ko Ko Gyi is the founder of the Myanmar Human Rights Human Dignity Film Festival and a known critic of the military's involvement in politics.

translation.yo: Àwọn alátìlẹ́yìn-in rẹ̀ ń pè fún ìtúsílẹ̀ẹ rẹ̀ lóríi ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn, látàrí wípé a ti yọ àbọ̀ ẹ̀dọ rẹ̀ nítorí àrùn jẹjẹrẹ àti àrùn ọkàn àti ìṣòro kíndìnrín.
translation.en: His supporters are calling for his release on humanitarian grounds, since he has had half of his liver removed due to cancer and suffers from heart and kidney problems.

translation.yo: Àjọṣe Eré Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn, tí ó jẹ́ àjọṣepọ̀ àjọ̀dún eré ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ ọmọnìyàn 40 kárí ayé, fi lẹ́tà ṣọwọ́ sí ìjọba:
translation.en: The Human Rights Film Network, a partnership of 40 human rights film festivals around the world, sent this letter to the government:

translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹgbẹ́ ajìjàǹgbara àgbáyé tí ọ̀rán kàn, a tọrọ ìdánilójú ìjọba Myanmar láti ríi dájú wípé Abala 66 (d), tí ó yẹ kí ó sún ìtẹ̀síwájú ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá síwájú, tí kò ní jẹ́ lílò fún ìpalẹ̀mọ́ ọmọ ìlúu Myanmar tí ó fẹ́ sọ èròo ọkàn-an wọn àti lọ́wọ́ sí ètò ìṣèlú ìjọba àwa-arawa ní Myanmar.
translation.en: As a concerned international human rights community, we seek reassurance from the Myanmar government to ensure that Section66(d), which was meant to enhance progress of telecommunications, will not be used to silence the voice of Myanmarese civilians seeking to voice their opinions and take part in the democratic process in Myanmar.

translation.yo: Lẹ́tà náà tọ́ka sí ti àríyànjiyàn Abala 66(d) tí ó sọ nípa òfin ìbánilórúkọjẹ́ tí àwọn aláṣẹ ń lò láti to fi ẹ̀sùn ìtakò, ìjìjàgbara, àti akọ̀ròyìn.
translation.en: The letter refers to the controversial Section 66(d) defamation law which has been used by authorities to charge critics, activists, and journalists.

translation.yo: Ilé ẹjọ́ ìbílẹ̀ kọ ìwé ẹ̀dùn tí Min Htin Ko Ko Gyi kọ fún béèlì. Ìgbẹ́jọ́ọ rẹ̀ tún di ọjọ́ 9, oṣù Èbìbì ọdún-un 2019.
translation.en: Min Htin Ko Ko Gyi's petition for bail was rejected by a local court. His next hearing is scheduled for May 9, 2019.

translation.yo: “Kò yẹ kí wọ́n di èrò ẹ̀wọ̀n ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀.”
translation.en: “They should never have been jailed in the first place.”

translation.yo: A rán Wa Lone àti Kyaw Soe Oo sí ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún méje fún rírú òfin Ìkọ̀kọ̀ sáà-akónilẹ́rú.
translation.en: Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo were sentenced to seven years in prison for violating the colonial-era Official Secrets Act.

translation.yo: Ilé Ẹjọ́ Àgbà di ìdálẹ́jọ́ tí wọ́n ṣe ní oṣù Igbe tí ó kọjá àmọ́ a dá wọn sílẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ìdáríjì ààrẹ ní àsìkò Ọdún Tuntun ìbílẹ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè náà.
translation.en: The Supreme Court upheld their conviction last April with finality but they were released from prison after they were granted a presidential pardon during the country’s traditional New Year.

translation.yo: Àwọn ẹgbẹ́ bíi Southeast Asian Press Alliance kí Wa Lone àti Kyaw Soe Oo káàbọ̀ lẹ́yìn-in tí a dá wọn sílẹ̀ àmọ́ wọ́n sọ ìyànjẹ tí ó kojú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn méjèèjì:
translation.en: Groups like the Southeast Asian Press Alliance welcomed the release of Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo but they also highlighted the injustice suffered by the two reporters:

translation.yo: Kò yẹ kí wọ́n di èrò ẹ̀wọ̀n ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀, nítorí wọn kò jẹ̀bi ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn wọ́n.
translation.en: They should never have been jailed in the first place, because they committed no crime.

translation.yo: Nígbàtí a gba ìdàgbàsókè yìí wọlé, ẹjọ́ọ Wa Lone àti Kyaw Soe Oo jẹ́ ẹ̀rí wípé ẹ̀mí àwọn akọ̀ròyìn tí ó ń ṣe àyẹ̀wò sí ìṣèlú wà nínú ewu ìgbẹ̀san òṣèlú.
translation.en: While we welcome this positive development, the case of Wa Lone and Kyaw Soe Oo is proof that journalists are in constant risk of political reprisal for keeping power in check.

translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ Brazili ra ìpín ìdókòòwò ní iléeṣẹ́ reluwé láti bá a wí fún ìkùnà ojúṣe àyíkáa rẹ̀
translation.en: Brazilian indigenous people buy shares in railway company to denounce its failed environmental obligations

translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ sọ wípé iṣẹ́ tuntun fífẹ reluwé ń kóbá àwọn ẹranko agbègbè náà àti ààbòo wọn.
translation.en: Indigenous peoples say the newly expanded railway impacted the area's wildlife and threatens their safety.

translation.yo: Àwòrán: Pedro Biava, tí a fi àṣẹ lò.
translation.en: Image: Pedro Biava, used with permission.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 24 oṣù Igbe, ìpàdé akópìnín Rumo Logística, ìgbìmọ̀ reluwé orílẹ̀ èdèe Brazili, gba àwọn àlejò àìròtẹ́lẹ̀ tuntun: ẹgbẹ́ ẹlẹ́ni márùn-ún ìbílẹ̀ kan tí ó wá láti ẹ̀yà Guarani àti Tupi tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ra ìpín ìdókòwò mẹ́fà iléeṣẹ́ náà.
translation.en: On April 24, the shareholders’ meeting of Rumo Logística, a Brazilian railway consortium, had a few new, unexpected faces: a group of five indigenous people of Guarani and Tupi ethnicities who had recently bought six shares of the company.

translation.yo: Ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan wọ́n jẹ́ aṣojú Ilẹ̀ Ìbílẹ̀ tí ìjọba fọwọ́ sí ní gúúsù ìlà oòrùn ìpínlẹ̀ São Paulo tí reluwé akẹ́rù aláàdọ́run ọdún iléeṣẹ́ Rumo ń kó bá, ní ọdún-un 2014, bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í fẹ̀ sí i.
translation.en: They each represent one of the five officially designated Indigenous Lands in the southeastern state of São Paulo that was affected by a 90-year-old cargo railway which Rumo operates and, in 2014, began to expand.

translation.yo: Láti san owóo gbà máà bínú fún ìbàjẹ́ tí ìmúgbòòrò sí i ilé iṣẹ́ náà kó bá agbègbèe náà, ìpínlẹ̀ ti fi ẹ̀tọ́ fún iiléeṣẹ́ reluwé náà láti "kọ́ ilé tuntun, ibùdó ìwúre, afárá, ọgbà àti ra ẹ̀rọ ìṣánko kékeré" fún àwọn agbègbè náà.
translation.en: In order to compensate for the impact caused by the railway expansion, the state contractually obligates the company to "build new houses, prayer sites, a bridge, community gardens and acquire micro-tractors" for the communities.

translation.yo: Ó tó bíi ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún ènìyàn tí ó ń gbé jákèjádò Ilẹ̀ Ìbílẹ̀ tí fífẹ̀ reluwé kó bá.
translation.en: Around 5,000 people live across the five Indigenous Lands impacted by the railway's expansion.

translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n àwọn aṣojú ìbílẹ̀ sọ wípé iléeṣẹ́ náà ti kùnà láti ṣe irú ẹ̀tọ́ náà, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ìròyìn láti ọwọ́ Folha de São Paulo.
translation.en: But indigenous representatives say the company has failed to fulfill such duties, according to a story by Folha de São Paulo.

translation.yo: Ọ̀fíìsì Abánirojọ̀ Ìjọba Àpapọ̀ jẹ́rìí sí i èyí: 63 nínúu iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe 97 ìwé àdéhùn ìfìmọ̀ṣọ̀kan ti di àpatì.
translation.en: The Federal Prosecutor's Office confirms this: 63 out of the 97 renovation works provided for in the concession contract are frozen.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 19 oṣù Igbe, àwọn afẹ̀sùnkanni pa á láṣẹ fún Ibama, àjọ ètò àyíká orílẹ̀ èdè Brazili, láti ṣíra dá iṣẹ́ reluwé tuntun náà dúró, wọ́n sì gba ìwé àṣẹ Rumo.
translation.en: On April 19, prosecutors recommended Ibama, Brazil's national environmental agency, to immediately suspend the new railway's construction as well as Rumo's operation license.

translation.yo: Bákan náà ni wọ́n tún gba àjọ náà níyànjú láti mú kí Rumo ó san owó ìtanràn mílíọ̀nù 10 owóo reais (ìyẹn mílíọ̀nù 2,5 owóo dọ́là orílẹ̀ èdèe US).
translation.en: They also recommended the agency to fine Rumo in 10 million reais (2,5 million US dollars).

translation.yo: Nínúu lẹ́tà tí a kà níbi àpèjọ ọjọ́ 24 oṣù Igbe, àwọn aràpín-ìdókòòwò ìbílẹ̀ náà ṣàlàyé ẹ̀dùn-un ọkàn-an wọn.
translation.en: In a letter read at the April 24 assembly, the five indigenous shareholders detailed their plight.

translation.yo: Wọ́n ti ṣe àlàyé ìjàmbá tí àwọn ọkọ̀ ojú irin náà ti fà fún ẹranko inú ìgbẹ́ tí ó wà ní agbègbè náà, àti dín àwọn ọmọ ènìyàn lọ́wọ́ láti fọ́n ká sí agbègbè.
translation.en: They've described how the trains have affected wildlife in the area, as well as limited people's circulation.

translation.yo: Ní àfikún, wọ́n ti jábọ̀ akitiyan ìtàkùrọ̀sọ wọn pẹ̀lú Rumo, tí wọ́n sì bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu Àtẹ̀jáde Ìgbéró Ọlọ́dọọdún-un iléeṣẹ́ náà, tí ó sọ pé Rumo "ń ṣe ojúṣe rẹ̀ bí ó ti tọ́ àti bí ó ti ṣe yẹ, ní ọ̀nà tí ó fa àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ wọ inú iṣẹ́ ".
translation.en: In addition, they've reported their struggle in dialoguing with the Rumo, and also discredited the corporation's latest Annual Sustainability Report, which states Rumo it is "perfectly fulfilling their obligations, in a participatory and inclusive way, with the affected indigenous communities".

translation.yo: Nígbà tí ó ń bá Pedro Biava ajábọ̀-ìròyìn ìwé ìròyìn Brasil de Fato fọ̀rọ̀jomitoro, Adriano Karai, tí ó wà láti agbègbè Guarani, sọ wípé ìlépa àwọn alájọpín ìdókòòwò ìbílẹ̀ náà ni láti mú kí ohùn-un wọn ó dé etí ìgbọ́ àwọn olùdókòòwò iléeṣẹ́ náà dípòo kí wọn ó jèrè láti ara ìdókòòwò náà (èyí tí wọ́n ra ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan-an ní 17 owó reais, tí ó tó bíi 4,30 owóo dọ́là US).
translation.en: Speaking with reporter Pedro Biava of newspaper Brasil de Fato, Adriano Karai, of Guarani ethnicity, said the indigenous shareholders’ goal was simply to have their voices heard by the company's investors rather than profiting from the shares (which they bought for 17 reais each, around 4,30 US dollars).

translation.yo: Karai tún ṣe àpèjúwe bí iṣẹ́ẹ fífẹ reluwé tuntun náà ti ṣe kóbá agbègbèe rẹ̀ Tenondé, tí ó wà ní ìlúu Paralheiros:
translation.en: Karai also described how the newly expanded railway has affected his community of Tenondé, located in the city of Paralheiros:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: Ariwo ọkọ̀ ojú irin náà, tí ó máa ń gbalẹ̀ kan títí lálẹ́.
translation.en: There is the noise of the train, which runs all night.

translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ẹranko kì í jẹ́ sí ibi ìdẹ mọ́ bíi tẹ́lẹ̀ .
translation.en: The animals don't show up at hunting places anymore.

translation.yo: A kò ní alẹ́ àìláriwo.
translation.en: We don’t have any quiet nights.

translation.yo: Bákan náà ni wọ́n máa ń gbé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọkàn tí ó máa ń dànù káàkiri ilẹ̀, a sì mọ́ wípé oúnjẹ yẹn kì í ṣe ojúlówó, tí àtọwọ́dá ni.
translation.en: They also transport a lot of grains that end up spilling on the land, and we know that that food isn't of good quality, it is transgenic.

translation.yo: Ẹ̀mí àwa gan-an alára ń bẹ nínú ewu: ọkọ̀ ojú irin náà ń gba ilẹ̀ àjogúnbáa wa kọjá, níbi tí àwọn àpá ẹsẹ̀ àwọn àlejò afẹsẹ̀ rìn tọ́.
translation.en: Our lives are also in danger: the train passes through our territories, where walk visiting communities through trails.

translation.yo: A wà nínú ewu ńlá ìjàmbá ikú ọkọ̀ ojú irin, nítorí ọkọ̀ ojú-irin ń pa ènìyàn nínúu ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́wàá mẹ́wàá báyìí.”
translation.en: We are in constant danger of being hit by a train, because now there is one every ten minutes.”

translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ìròyìn Folha, ní àkọ́kọ́, àwọn agbègbè ìbílẹ̀ ti gbèrò pẹ̀lú Rumo wípé kí ó gbé iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe náà fún ìgbìmọ̀ tí ó jẹ́ ọmọ ìbílẹ̀.
translation.en: According to the Folha story, the indigenous communities initially proposed to Rumo that it outsourced the renovation works to a local committee run by the communities themselves.

translation.yo: Ní ti Ọ́fíìsì Abánirojọ̀, iléeṣẹ́ náà ti kọ́kọ́ gba àbá náà wọlé, ṣùgbọ́n ní kété tí ó di ẹ̀yìn-in ìbò oṣù Ọ̀wẹwẹ̀ ọdún-un 2018 tí ó gbé Ààrẹ Jair Bolsonaro tí kò fi bò wípé òun kórìíra ti ìbílẹ̀ sí orí àlèèfà, àyípadà dé bá ìpinnu ìgbésè ti ó wà nílẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀tẹ́lẹ́rí.
translation.en: According to the Prosecutor's Office, the company had initially agreed, but shortly after the October 2018 election of President Jair Bolsonaro, who ran on an explicitly anti-indigenous platform, it shifted its approach.

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 20 oṣù Belu, Rumo ṣàì dédé fagi lé ìkópa pẹ̀lú àwọn agbègbè ìbílẹ̀, tí kò ì tíì tún yọjú níbi ìpàdé láti ìgbà náà.
translation.en: On November 20, Rumo suddenly canceled its participation at a meeting with the communities, and since then hasn't shown up at any other meetings.

translation.yo: Nínú ìtàkùrọ̀sọ pẹ̀lú Folha, iléeṣẹ́ náà sọ wípé òun kò fi ìgbà kan t'ọwọ́ bọ ìwé àdéhùn pẹ̀lú àwọn agbègbè ìbílẹ̀ náà láti gbé iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe náà fún wọn ṣe.
translation.en: Speaking with Folha, the company said it never signed any agreement with the indigenous communities of outsourcing the renovation works to their committee.

translation.yo: Àpéjọ àwọn alájọpín ìdókòòwò tí ó wáyé lọ́jọ́ 24 oṣù Igbe wá sí òpin láì sí ìpinnu tí ó lórí, àmọ́ àwọn aṣojú Rumo sọ wípé ọ̀rọ̀ ti ìbílẹ̀ náà yóò jẹ́ sísọ nínú ìpàdé ti abẹ́nú tí yóò wáyé nínú oṣù Èbìbì.
translation.en: The shareholders’ assembly on April 24 ended without any formal agreements, but Rumo's representatives said that the indigenous claims will be discussed at an internal meeting in May.

translation.yo: Iṣẹ́ àtúnṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní 2014. Àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ tí ó ń gbé ní agbègbè náà tó bíi 5,000.
translation.en: Expansion works began in 2014. Around 5,000 indigenous peoples live in the area.

translation.yo: Àwòrán: Pedro Biava, pẹ̀lú àṣẹ ni a fi lò ó.
translation.en: Image: Pedro Biava, used with permission.

translation.yo: Ìjàgbara Alájọpín-ìdókòòwò
translation.en: Shareholder activism

translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ Guarani àti Tupi nìkan kọ́ ni ó ṣe ohun tí a pè ní "ìjàgbara alájọpín- ìdókòòwò", tí ó jẹ́ ohun tuntun ní Brazil.
translation.en: The Guarani and Tupi aren't the only ones engaging with so-called "shareholder activism", a practice that isn't very common in Brazil.

translation.yo: Ní ọdún-un 2010, ẹgbẹ́ Ìmọ́rọ̀-yéni-yékéyéké àwọn tí ọ̀ràn-an Vale náà kàn (Articulação dos Atingidos e Atingidas pela Vale) ra ìpín ìdókòòwò iléeṣẹ́ náà láti lè bá wọn jókòó ní àjọ wọn.
translation.en: In 2010, the group Articulation of those Affected by Vale (Articulação dos Atingidos e Atingidas pela Vale) purchased the company's shares in order to sit at their assemblies.

translation.yo: Vale ni ọkàn lára iléeṣẹ́ awakùsà ní àgbáyé, òun sì ni ó ṣe àkóso ìdídò tí ó ba ìlúu Brumadinho jẹ́ nínú oṣùu Ṣẹẹrẹ ọdún-un 2019, tí ó mú ẹ̀mí èèyàn-an 236 lọ (tí 34 ṣì ti di ẹni àwátì).
translation.en: Vale one of the largest mining corporations in the world, and the operator of the dam that ruptured in the city of Brumadinho in January 2019, killing 236 people (34 are still missing).

translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 30 oṣù Igbe, ọjọ́ ìpàdé alájọpín ìdókòòwò, àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ Ìmọ́rọ̀-yéni-yékéyéké lẹ ìwé-àlẹ̀mógiri tí a tẹ orúkọ àwọn tí ó ti re ọ̀run àrìnmabọ̀ mọ́ ara ògiri olú-ilé-iṣẹ́ẹ Vale, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìwé ìròyìn O Globo ti rò ó.
translation.en: On April 30, the day of a shareholders’ meeting, Articulation members pinned posters with the deceased people's names on the walls of Vale's headquarters, as reported by newspaper O Globo.

translation.yo: Nítorí àìdéènà-pa-ẹnu ọ̀ràn tí ó kàn wọ́n gbọ̀ngbọ̀n nínú àwọn ìpàdé wọ̀nyẹn, ó di dandan kí àwọn iléeṣẹ́ náà ó kọ ohun tí àwọn ajìjàgbara náà ń fẹ́ sílẹ̀ nínú ìpàdée wọn.
translation.en: By voicing their concerns at those meetings, the companies are forced to register the activists’ demands in their minutes.

translation.yo: Obìnrin kan lára àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ Ìmọ́rọ̀-yéni-yékéyéké, Carolina de Moura, tí òun náà ní ìpín nínú ìdókòòwò Vale, sọ fún O Globo:
translation.en: One of the Articulation members, Carolina de Moura, herself a Vale shareholder, told O Globo:

translation.yo: Ìtúmọ̀ Ìtúnwí-ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́rọ̀ gan-an
translation.en: Translation Original Quote

translation.yo: A kò ní dẹ́kun láti máa sọ ohun tí ó ń gbé wa lọ́kàn síta fún aráyé gbọ́.
translation.en: We will keep speaking up.

translation.yo: Iléeṣẹ́ náà gbọdọ̀ lo èrè tí wọ́n bá rí fi tún àwọn odòo wa ṣe àti ṣíṣe àbójútó ẹ̀mí ọmọ ènìyàn.
translation.en: The company must invest everything they make in improving our rivers and caring about human lives.

translation.yo: Ìjọba Tanzania fi Ajìjàgbara Ọmọ Orílẹ̀-èdèe Uganda sí àtìmọ́lé, wọ́n sì lé e kúrò nílùú
translation.en: Tanzanian authorities detain and deport Ugandan human rights leader

translation.yo: Dókítà Wairagala Wakabi [Àwòrán láti CIPESA tí a fi àṣẹ lò]
translation.en: Dr. Wairagala Wakabi [Image by CIPESA and used with permission]

translation.yo: Wairagala Wakabi, àgbà ọ̀jẹ̀ ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá tí ó wá láti Uganda, di ẹni àtìmọ́lé ní Pápákọ̀ òfuurufú Julius Nyerere International Airport ní Dar es Salaam, Tanzania lọ́jọ́ 25 oṣù Igbe.
translation.en: Wairagala Wakabi, a leading digital rights advocate from Uganda, was detained at Julius Nyerere International Airport in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania on April 25.

translation.yo: A fi ìwé pe Wakabi kí ó wá á sọ̀rọ̀ níbi ètò Àyájọ́ Àwọn Olùgbèjà Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ní Tanzania ọlọ́dọọdún tí Àgbáríjọ Olùgbèjà Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ti Tanzania (THRDC) jẹ́ olùgbàlejò.
translation.en: Wakabi was invited to speak at the annual Tanzania Human Rights Defenders’ Day hosted by the Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition (THRDC).

translation.yo: Wakabi ni Olùdarí Àgbà Ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ Ètò-ìmúlò Ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ Gbogboògbò fún Ìlà-Oòrùn àti Gúúsù Ilẹ̀ Adúláwò (CIPESA), ọ̀kan gbòógì nínú ilé-iṣẹ́ tí ó ń ṣe ètò tí ó dá lórí ètò-ìmúlò ẹ̀rọ ayélujára àti òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ ní orí ayélujára ní ilẹ̀ Adúláwò.
translation.en: Wakabi is the Executive Director of the Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA), one of the foremost organizations working on internet policy and online free speech in Africa.

translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wákàtí tí a fi ọ̀rọ̀ wá Wakabi lẹ́nu wò, tí wọn kò sì jẹ́ kí ó rí agbẹjọ́rò, a dá a padà sí Uganda.
translation.en: Wakabi was deported back to Uganda after several hours of interrogation, during which he was denied access to a lawyer.

translation.yo: Àwọn aṣojú láti Àgbáríjọ Olùgbèjà Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn gbìyànjú láti jà fún un, àmọ́ a sọ fún wọn wípé fún "àǹfààní ìlú" ni a fi dá Wakabi padà sí ìlúu rẹ̀:
translation.en: Attorneys from the Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition attempted to advocate on his behalf, but were told only that Wakabi was being deported on grounds of "national interest":

translation.yo: Bí ó ti lẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kò ju wákàtí díẹ̀ lọ, ó mú ìjáyà ńlá bá àwọn ajàfẹ́tọ̀ọ́ ní agbègbè náà, tí ọ̀ràn ìwà àìtọ́ tí orílẹ̀-èdèe Tanzania ń wù sí àwọn ajìjàgbara àti oníṣẹ́-ìròyìn ń peléke sí i.
translation.en: Though the ordeal lasted only a few hours, it brought great consternation among rights advocates in the region, who have grown wary of Tanzania's treatment of activists and journalists.

translation.yo: Nínú oṣù Belu ọdún tí ó ré kọjá, àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Ìgbìmọ̀ tí ó ń Dáàbò bo Oníṣẹ́-ìròyìn, Angela Quintal àti Muthoki Mumo di ẹni àtìmọ́lé fún ọ̀pọ̀ wákàtí ní Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, tí ìwé ẹ̀rí ọmọ-ìlú-fún-ìrìnnàa wọ́n di gbígbà lọ́wọ́ọ wọn.
translation.en: In November last year, Angela Quintal and Muthoki Mumo both staff of Committee to Protect Journalists, were detained for several hours in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, and had their passports temporarily seized.

translation.yo: Human Rights Watch sọ wípé lábẹ́ ìṣàkóso ìjọba Ààrẹ John Magufuli Tanzania ti rí "ìrésílẹ̀ ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ, ìkẹ́gbẹ́ àti àpéjọ dé ojú àmì".
translation.en: Human Rights Watch asserted that Tanzania under the leadership President John Magufuli has witnessed "a marked decline in respect for free expression, association and assembly".

translation.yo: Ní ọdún-un 2015, Orílẹ̀èdè Olómìnira Ìṣọ̀kan Tanzania kéde Ìgbésẹ̀ Ìrúfin Orí Ẹ̀rọ Ayélujára.
translation.en: In 2015, the United Republic of Tanzania promulgated the Cybercrimes Act.

translation.yo: Ní àárín ọdún kan tí a kéde òfin yẹn, ó ti tó bí ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdèe Tanzania 14 tí òfín ti mú tí a sì ti dálẹ́jọ́ lábẹ́ òfin fún pé wọ́n sọ̀rọ̀ mọ́ṣààsí sí ààrẹ lórí ẹ̀rọ alátagbà.
translation.en: Within a year of the passing of that law, at least 14 Tanzanians were arrested and prosecuted under the law for insulting the president on social media.

translation.yo: Pẹ́pẹ́yẹ gbé ọmọ pọ̀n nínú oṣù Ẹrẹ́nà ọdún-un 2018 nígbàtí a gba Ìlànà Ẹ̀rọ Ayárabíàṣá (Ohun orí ayélujára) àti Ìtàkùrọ̀sọ Ìfìwéránṣẹ́ wọlé tí ó mú un ní túláàsì fún àwọn akọbúlọ́ọ̀gù láti fi orúkọ sílẹ̀ tí wọ́n á sì san owó orí tí ó tó bíi US $900 lọ́dún kí wọn ó tó lè gbé àtẹ̀jáde sí orí ayélujára.
translation.en: March 2018 saw the passing of the Electronic and Postal Communications (Online Content) Regulations, making it mandatory for bloggers to register and pay roughly US $900 per year to publish online.

translation.yo: Èyí mú kí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ búlọ́ọ̀gù aládàádúró ó wọ òkùnkùn.
translation.en: This caused many independent blogs to go dark.

translation.yo: Ìpalẹ́numọ́ iléeṣẹ́ akọ̀ròyìn aládàádúró nípasẹ̀ àwọn àdàlù ìṣíwèé fún ilé iṣẹ́ akọ̀ròyìn àti ìrókẹ́kẹ́ mọ́ oníṣẹ́-ìròyìn ti di ìdẹ́rùbà, ìkóra-ẹni-ní-ìjánu àti ìbẹ̀rù láti sọ èrò ọkàn ẹni nípa àwọn olórí orílẹ̀ èdè náà.
translation.en: The stifling of independent media through a mixture of sanctions against media outlets and legal threats against journalists has created an atmosphere of intimidation, self-censorship and fear of expressing alternative views about the country’s leaders.

translation.yo: Àtìmọ́lé àti ìdápadà Wakabi sí Uganda jẹ́ ìtẹ̀síwájú ìdojú-ìjà-kọ òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ tòun èrò ọkàn ẹni ní Tanzania.
translation.en: The detention and subsequent deportation of Wakabi back to Uganda appears to be a continuation of the Tanzania's government assault on free speech and dissent.

translation.yo: Oníròyìn Orí ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà Luis Carlos Diaz di àwátì ní Venezuela
translation.en: Digital journalist Luis Carlos Diaz is missing in Venezuela

translation.yo: "Níbo ni Luis Carlos wà?"
translation.en: "Where is Luis Carlos?"

translation.yo: Àwòrán ìpolongo orí ayélujára tí Provea taari síta.
translation.en: Image of the public online campaign shared by Provea.

translation.yo: Wọ́n sọ ìgbà tí a pè é kẹ́yìn àti túwíìtì tí ó tẹ̀ kẹ́yìn nínú àwòrán náà.
translation.en: In the image they indicate the last time he had been contacted and the last time he tweeted.

translation.yo: Ní ìrọ̀lẹ́ ọjọ́ 11, oṣù Ẹrẹ́nà olùfèsì sí ọ̀rọ̀ ìṣèlú Naky Soto tí ó tún jẹ́ aya akọ̀ròyìn àti ajììjàǹgbara iṣẹ́ ìròyìn tí ó jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀ Venezuela, Luis Carlos Díaz túwíìtì pé òun ti ń wá ọkọ òun fún wákàtí márùn-ún.
translation.en: On the evening of March 11, political commentator Naky Soto and wife of Venezuelan journalist and media activist Luis Carlos Diaz tweeted that he had been missing for five hours.

translation.yo: [Ìròyìn tí ó tẹ̀ wá lọ́wọ́] Àjọ àwọn Òṣìṣẹ́ Ìròyìn (SNTP lédè Spanish) jábọ̀ pé àwọn Agbófinró Ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ Bolivaria (SEBIN) ti fi Luis Carlos sí àtìmọ́lé.
translation.en: [Update] The Union of Press Workers (in Spanish, the SNTP) reported that Luis Carlos had been detained by the Bolivarian Intelligence Forces (SEBIN):

translation.yo: PÀJÁWÌRÌ Àjọ Sebin kan fìdíi rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ pé akọ̀ròyìn Luis Carlos Diaz ti wà ní àhámọ́ àwọn ọlọ́pàá yẹn.
translation.en: URGENT A Sebin commission confirms that journalist Luis Carlos Díaz has been detained by that police organism.

translation.yo: Wọ́n yọ àwọn ohun ìjà ti akọ̀ròyìn Marco Ruiz, Luz Mely Rehes àti Federico Black [pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ ìròyìn.
translation.en: They pointed their weapons at journalist [and members of the Press Union] Marco Ruiz, Luz Mely Reyes and Federico Black.

translation.yo: Wákàtí díẹ̀ sẹ́yìn, Soto túwíìtì pé àwọn ti ń wá Luis Carlos Díaz fún wákàtí márùn-ún:
translation.en: Hours before, Soto had tweeted that Luis Carlos Díaz had been missing for five hours:

translation.yo: @LuisCarlos wà ní orí kẹ̀kẹ́ẹ rẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n láti aago 5:30 ni mi kò ti gbúròó rẹ̀ mọ́, bẹ́ẹ̀:
translation.en: @LuisCarlos is on his bike, but since 5:30 I've heard nothing from him and:

translation.yo: – Kò sí ní ilé iṣẹ́ ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ náà
translation.en: – he's not at the radio station

translation.yo: – Kò sí nílé
translation.en: – he's not at home

translation.yo: – Kò tíì túwíìtì
translation.en: – he hasn't tweeted

translation.yo: – Kò gbé ìpèe rẹ̀
translation.en: – he isn't answering calls

translation.yo: – Kò fèsì sí àtẹ̀jíṣẹ́ tàbí iṣẹ́-ìjẹ́ oríi WhatsApp
translation.en: – he isn't answering SMS or WhatsApp messages
